[{'created': '2020-01-24 17:30:09.000000000', 'message': "Add error message when merge fails

If the source cfg directory contains a path (e.g.
/etc/pki/ca-trust/extracted/) which is also bind mounted into the

Related-Bug: #1860607
"}]
commit_message:
Add error message when merge fails

If the source cfg directory contains a path (e.g.
/etc/pki/ca-trust/extracted/) which is also bind mounted into the
container as read-only, when it attempts to merge the paths together
the resulting exception doesn't really indicate what happened.

Change-Id: I73bbfd31586012e1fd64d30f9ce1d7eb2256d210
Related-Bug: #1860607

commit_message:
Enable Glance to use Cinder iSCSI backend

To use an iSCSI Cinder backend as its store, glance_api must run
privileged and have /dev and /etc/iscsi properly mounted

Co-authored-by: Rados켹aw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I988d3c9d0564483440ae17203ad88a8049abbea4
Closes-Bug: #1855695
(cherry picked from commit fa49b2692de1b38bfdf47e1468296770d5dfff89)

subject: External Ceph: copy also cinder keyring to nova services
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-01-28 16:10:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-01-28 19:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-01-29 07:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-28 16:10:44.000000000', 'message': 'External Ceph: copy also cinder keyring to nova services

Since [1] nova-compute uses rbd python library instead of libvirt to cleanup
volumes and get pool info - so it requires cinder keyring on filesystem.

In external ceph case it is often that nova key does not exist (is simply a copied
cinder key) and the rbd user is set to cinder - therefore the earlier mentioned
operations will fail due to a missing keyring on the filesystem.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668564/

Change-Id: Idef21dc5f7e9ff512bc8920630a3de61a1e69eee
Backport: train
Closes-Bug: #1859408
(cherry picked from commit 71d4c697cdb982d7d8e6cbd95ad870eb08f6914e)
'}]
commit_message:
External Ceph: copy also cinder keyring to nova services

Since [1] nova-compute uses rbd python library instead of libvirt to cleanup
volumes and get pool info - so it requires cinder keyring on filesystem.

In external ceph case it is often that nova key does not exist (is simply a copied
cinder key) and the rbd user is set to cinder - therefore the earlier mentioned
operations will fail due to a missing keyring on the filesystem.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/668564/

Change-Id: Idef21dc5f7e9ff512bc8920630a3de61a1e69eee
Backport: train
Closes-Bug: #1859408
(cherry picked from commit 71d4c697cdb982d7d8e6cbd95ad870eb08f6914e)

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.
Update to reflect reality, which should help with local running of
constraints targets.

Change-Id: I29835f60eceba5551bafade3e522898f3f7eae31

commit_message:
Fix stackviz installation

Install stackviz with pip without a venv fails due requirements
constraints. This patch install and run stackviz from venv in order to
fix this.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582468/
Change-Id: I47a37020d21cfff248f908136ee0d6a43ad8b205
Closes-Bug: 1779562

commit_message:
Define python3 as basepython for Tempest tox env

While OpenStack is in transition to drop py2, many
lib or dependency of Tempest or its plugins cannot
be installed on python 2.7.

To install Tempest on py3 evnv, let's change the basepython
as python 3 for tox env.

Defining basepython as python3.6 for all venv using
.tox/tempest.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703476/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703679/

Closes-Bug: 1860033
Change-Id: If3ff71dbe636ef98072b15f6599e6e641c222f30

commit_message:
Re-proposes multiple vGPU types in libvirt

This spec is for telling libvirt how to manage multiple vGPU types.
The only modification to the approved spec in Stein is to mention
another alternative and no longer mention upgrades since GPUs are
already modeled as children RPs.

Change-Id: Ib125c9de60ac614b4b8cb3ad0f03a4141efd0d2a
Partially-Implements: bp/vgpu-multiple-types
Previously-Approved: Stein

commit_message:
iptables and queens

disable docker iptables for queens.
In CI the docker login in zuul playbooks
breaks the overcloud deployment
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1845166/

Customers should not hit this issue.

Closes-Bug: #1845166
Change-Id: I0ea3adb80212793e49474a8c49f8b9b055395379

commit_message:
Make tripleo-tox-molecule use centos-8 nodes

Use molecule jobs with centos-8 based nodes as these do have newer
docker versions.

commit_message:
DNM: test bleading edge molecule dependencies

This change is used to verify that the unreleased code of molecule and
its major dependencies does not break our jobs.

This is not supposed to be merged, only to be used for testing upcoming
releases of these packages.

Change-Id: I854b7b5adda8486fddf389c4e2cfb67d521f06ad

subject: Bypass pip-and-virtualenv for later redhat distros
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4146, 'name': 'Clark Boylan', 'email': 'cboylan@sapwetik.org', 'username': 'cboylan'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 9311, 'name': 'Tristan Cacqueray', 'email': 'tdecacqu@redhat.com', 'username': 'tristanC'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13294, 'name': 'Javier Pe침a', 'email': 'jpena@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpena'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24162, 'name': 'Sorin Sb칙rnea', 'display_name': 'zbr', 'email': 'ssbarnea@redhat.com', 'username': 'ssbarnea', 'status': 'do not feed the troll 游볫'}, {'_account_id': 28743, 'name': 'huang liujie', 'email': 'huang.liujie@99cloud.net', 'username': 'ljhuang'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-05-01 14:34:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2019-05-01 14:42:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

have you tries just using:

  export DIB_INSTALLTYPE_pip_and_virtualenv=package

over source installs? I _think_ that gets what you are looking for right? That will use the default distro packages for both pip and virtualenv.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-05-01 14:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Paul, one of the affected jobs is https://github.com/rdo-infra/review.rdoproject.org-config/blob/master/zuul.d/tripleoci.yaml#L61 -- I doubt I can change the image being used by adding an environment variable.

I think that the idea is to avoid creating tainted images in the first place, for any jobs.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2019-05-01 14:52:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

you'd set the variable in nodepool.yaml file, so when nodepool-builder creates the initial image, if won't use the source install for pip-ansible-virtualenv. it is a change for all jobs, that is the trade off."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-05-06 12:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-05-06 12:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-05-24 07:04:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Yeah, to echo Paul's point -- the whole idea of the source install is to, well, source install.  This has traditionally been necessary in LTS type environments where openstack has triggered pip/virutalenv/setuptools bugs.

The idea would be that for certain images; fedora in particular that keeps itself up-to-date, we could build our infra images using the packaged versions as mentioned with the "use from packages" flag.

But I keep thinking that ... and pip etc keeps finding ways to break itself.  Like just a week or so ago we had it changing the way it dealt with projects with toml files (https://discuss.python.org/t/pip-19-1-and-installing-in-editable-mode-with-pyproject-toml/1553) which then got reverted in pip and now, I don't know, I haven't kept up -- but this is the type of thing to keep CI going you need to either pin to earlier versions or install the latest version for.  Even though Fedora might get it fixed in a few days, nobody wants to wait that long when they've got stuff to merge (and forget about LTS distros where you're talking months to get a fix in...)

I *get* that the package pinning is odd and breaks puppet/ansible assumptions.  But then we have issues like above that need to be worked around to unbreak CI just as much too.

I think we've mentioned that dnf can do the pinning better; so the package doesn't look uninstalled?  Did we look into that?'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-05-24 11:24:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I am not against installing pip/virtualenv from source as long we do not override the system versions. Currently on redhat distros this can only be done by installing using `--user` option. Debian-ish distros did something smart where distro python packages have location different than the pip ones, which means they never override each-other. If I remember well, the pip sys-path is listed before the pkg-system one, so it would take precedence. The user-path has the same behavior, the only issue is that: cli tools may not be in PATH (module calling works well) and that when you create a virtualenv, these modules are not available -- this one not being a real issue.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-09-05 07:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

There are some hacks that are made during image preparation that do adulterate the builded images in such way that are no longer support by their vendors. Testing code on these will not match production environments so lots of issues will be introduced.


I do perfectly understand that we may want to use latest pip/virtualenv/setuptools/tox for some jobs but this should not be part of the builded image. If a job needs these tools, it can have them, but it needs to specifically mention that in its definition.

One adulterated image cannot be repaired, but one that is in clean/supported mode, can be upgraded.

In fact the main point here was related to stuff like
a) creating a symlink for python executable, which is known to be again a well known PEP. This must be avoided, as we want to catch bugs caused by call of "python" on distros without such exec.

b) Python2 installation should not be forced on images that use natively python3. Again, installing it can hide other bugs.

c) We are missing to spot bugs like there is no pip/virtualenv on py3 distros, exec being called pip3 and virtualenv-3. We do need to restrain ourselves from trying to make system level hacks, as this means that result of test execution would not be trusted to match (or be very close to) what user will encounter in production.

I hope this explains why I wanted to change how we build images and please let me know what actions we can do to address these points. Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 28743, 'date': '2019-09-14 15:14:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2019-10-01 04:42:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I do perfectly understand that we may want to use latest pip/virtualenv/setuptools/tox for some jobs but this should not be part of the builded image.

Fundamentally I think we all agree on this.  The problem has been we can't pull the rug out from every job that has been built with assumptions about the status quo.

I think https://review.opendev.org/#/c/684462 is the way forward.  That removes source install of pip/virtualenv for Centos8.  Once we have that operational, I could see similar being done for future Fedora releases.  As other distros update, we can phase out the idea of installing from source in the base images."}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-01-29 09:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Bypass pip-and-virtualenv for later redhat distros

We just use the packaged versions and avoid overriding any rpms.

This ensures that the builder images are not tainted in a way that would
make them considered unsupported.

Allows us to use them for testing real-life use-scenarios.

Change-Id: I4e088dd91ff7644c083e6c96ac28c201e00ecb0d
Fixes-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1826452

After talking this over in #openstack-qa it looks like we are going to resolve this by hacking things on our xenial images so python3 resolves to 3.6 before reverting If3ff71dbe636ef98072b15f6599e6e641c222f30:

09:17:33      yoctozepto | let's alias python on xenial                                                                                                                                                                                                                                
09:17:45      yoctozepto | and revert that change                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
09:18:16        frickler | yoctozepto: yes, I think that that will be better. we are doing a lot of hacks on xenial anyway, let's keep it confined to that legacy environment"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-29 09:11:44.000000000', 'message': 'tempest: Install python36 on Fedora

If3ff71dbe636ef98072b15f6599e6e641c222f30 has switched the basepython
version of tempestenv to python3.6. This breaks the installation of
Tempest on Fedora where only python3.7 is provided by default. To
workaround this for now we can install the python36 package alongside
python37, this should obviously be removed when Tempest moves past
python3.6.

Closes-Bug: #1861263
Change-Id: Ic4e8cb2569b3dd3562c737fa166fc8d521db1bfa
'}]
commit_message:
tempest: Install python36 on Fedora

If3ff71dbe636ef98072b15f6599e6e641c222f30 has switched the basepython
version of tempestenv to python3.6. This breaks the installation of
Tempest on Fedora where only python3.7 is provided by default. To
workaround this for now we can install the python36 package alongside
python37, this should obviously be removed when Tempest moves past
python3.6.

Closes-Bug: #1861263
Change-Id: Ic4e8cb2569b3dd3562c737fa166fc8d521db1bfa

messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-01-28 16:06:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-01-28 19:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2020-01-29 07:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-28 16:06:49.000000000', 'message': 'Allow ironic_ipxe to serve instance images

Ironic provides a feature to allow instance images to be served from a
local HTTP server [1]. This is the same server used for PXE images with
iPXE. This does not work currently because the ironic_ipxe container
does not have access to /var/lib/ironic/images (ironic docker volume),
where the images are cached. Note that to make use of this feature, the
following is required in ironic.conf:

[agent]
image_download_source = http

This change fixes the issue by giving ironic_ipxe container access to
the ironic volume.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/interfaces/deploy.html#deploy-with-custom-http-servers

Change-Id: I501d02cfd40fbacea32d551c3912640c5661d821
Closes-Bug: #1856194
(cherry picked from commit 2b662cfb127c9abc4930c498d7f9957a8065f5ce)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow ironic_ipxe to serve instance images

Ironic provides a feature to allow instance images to be served from a
local HTTP server [1]. This is the same server used for PXE images with
iPXE. This does not work currently because the ironic_ipxe container
does not have access to /var/lib/ironic/images (ironic docker volume),
where the images are cached. Note that to make use of this feature, the
following is required in ironic.conf:

[agent]
image_download_source = http

This change fixes the issue by giving ironic_ipxe container access to
the ironic volume.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/admin/interfaces/deploy.html#deploy-with-custom-http-servers

Change-Id: I501d02cfd40fbacea32d551c3912640c5661d821
Closes-Bug: #1856194
(cherry picked from commit 2b662cfb127c9abc4930c498d7f9957a8065f5ce)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-08 23:36:49.000000000', 'message': 'tools: Adding scripts to help with networking-ovn migration

In an effort to help on migrating changes on netowking-ovn to neutron,
these 3 scripts are being introduced.

1) files_in_patch.py ==> show files that are changed in a patch_file

$ # make a patch to use as example
$ git show > /tmp/commit.patch

$ ./tools/files_in_patch.py /tmp/commit.patch
tools/download_gerrit_change.py
tools/files_in_patch.py
tools/migrate_names.py
tools/migrate_names.txt
$

2) download_gerrit_change.py ==> given a gerrit change id, download latest
   patchset as a patch_file

$ ./tools/download_gerrit_change.py -h
usage: download_gerrit_change.py [-h] gerritChange [output] [url]

Get patch file for a gerrit

positional arguments:
  gerritChange  the gerrit change id
  output        file containing the gerrit change
  url           the url to Gerrit server

optional arguments:
  -h, --help    show this help message and exit
$ ./tools/download_gerrit_change.py 698863 /tmp/change.patch
$ ./tools/files_in_patch.py !$
./tools/files_in_patch.py /tmp/change.patch
networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
networking_ovn/ml2/trunk_driver.py
networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py
networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py

3) ./tools/migrate_names.py ==> given a gerrit change id or a patch_file, use mapfile
   to rename files in patch

$ ./tools/migrate_names.py --help
Usage: migrate_names.py [OPTIONS]

Options:
  -i, --input_patch TEXT    input_patch patch file or gerrit change
  -o, --output TEXT         Output patch file. Default: stdout
  -m, --mapfile PATH        Data file that specifies mapping to be applied to
                            input
  --reverse / --no-reverse  Map filenames from neutron to networking-ovn repo
  --help                    Show this message and exit.
$ ./tools/migrate_names.py -i /tmp/change.patch -o /tmp/neutron_change.patch
$ ./tools/migrate_names.py -o /tmp/change.patch.2 -i /tmp/neutron_change.patch --reverse
$ diff /tmp/change.patch /tmp/change.patch
$ diff /tmp/change.patch /tmp/neutron_change.patch
38,39c38,39
< --- a/networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
< +++ b/networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
---
> --- a/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py
> +++ b/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py
84,85c84,85
<%-%- snip %-%->

$ ./tools/files_in_patch.py /tmp/neutron_change.patch
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py
neutron/services/trunk/drivers/ovn/trunk_driver.py
neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py
neutron/tests/unit/services/trunk/drivers/ovn/test_trunk_driver.py

Change-Id: I17904c996e1357f7292d25aab4d448edb052f44c

'}, {'created': '2020-01-13 23:32:43.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] scripts for networking-ovn code migration

In an effort to help on migrating changes from neutron to networking-ovn,
these 3 scripts are being introduced under tools.

Also adding documentation about these under OVN folder.

1) files_in_patch.py
Use this to show files that are changed in a patch file.

   $ # Make a patch to use as example
   $ git show > /tmp/commit.patch

   $ ./tools/files_in_patch.py /tmp/commit.patch | grep .py
   tools/download_gerrit_change.py
   tools/files_in_patch.py
   tools/migrate_names.py

2) download_gerrit_change.py
Given a gerrit change id, it will fetch the latest patchset of the change
from review.opendev.org as a patch file.

   $ ./tools/download_gerrit_change.py -h
   usage: download_gerrit_change.py [-h] gerritChange [output] [url]

   Get patch file for a gerrit

   positional arguments:
     gerritChange  the gerrit change id
     output        file containing the gerrit change
     url           the url to Gerrit server

   $ ./tools/download_gerrit_change.py 698863 /tmp/change.patch
   $ ./tools/files_in_patch.py !$
   networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
   networking_ovn/ml2/trunk_driver.py
   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py
   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py

3) ./tools/migrate_names.py
Use this tool to modify the name of the files in a patchfile so it can
be converted to/from the legacy networking-ovn and neutron repositories.

   $ ./tools/migrate_names.py --help
   Usage: migrate_names.py [OPTIONS]

   Options:
     -i, --input_patch TEXT    input_patch patch file or gerrit change
     -o, --output TEXT         Output patch file. Default: stdout
     -m, --mapfile PATH        Data file that specifies mapping to be applied to
                               input  [default: ./tools/migrate_names.txt]
     --reverse / --no-reverse  Map filenames from networking-ovn to neutron repo

   $ ./tools/migrate_names.py -i 701646 > /tmp/ovn_change.patch
   $ ./tools/migrate_names.py -o /tmp/change.patch.reverse -i /tmp/ovn_change.patch --reverse
   $ diff /tmp/change.patch.reverse /tmp/ovn_change.patch
   40,41c40,41
   < --- a/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py
   < +++ b/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py
   ---
   > --- a/networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
   > +++ b/networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
   <... snip ...>

   $ ./tools/files_in_patch.py /tmp/ovn_change.patch
   networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
   networking_ovn/ml2/trunk_driver.py
   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py
   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py

Change-Id: I17904c996e1357f7292d25aab4d448edb052f44c
Related-Blueprint: neutron-ovn-merge

   Usage: download_gerrit_change.py [OPTIONS] GERRIT_CHANGE

   Options:
     -o, --output_patch TEXT  Output patch file  [default: stdout]
     -g, --gerrit_url TEXT    The url to Gerrit server  [default:
                              https://review.opendev.org/]
     -t, --timeout INTEGER    Timeout, in seconds  [default: 10]
     --help                   Show this message and exit.

   $ ./tools/download_gerrit_change.py 698863 -o /tmp/change.patch
   $ ./tools/files_in_patch.py /tmp/change.patch
   networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py

   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py
   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py

3) migrate_names.py
Use this tool to modify the name of the files in a patchfile so it can
be converted to/from the legacy networking-ovn and neutron repositories.

                               input  [default: /home/user/openstack/neutron.git

   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py

commit_message:
[OVN] scripts for networking-ovn code migration

In an effort to help on migrating changes from neutron to networking-ovn,
these 3 scripts are being introduced under tools.

Also adding documentation about these under OVN folder.

1) files_in_patch.py
Use this to show files that are changed in a patch file.

   $ # Make a patch to use as example
   $ git show > /tmp/commit.patch

   $ ./tools/files_in_patch.py /tmp/commit.patch | grep .py
   tools/download_gerrit_change.py
   tools/files_in_patch.py
   tools/migrate_names.py

2) download_gerrit_change.py
Given a gerrit change id, it will fetch the latest patchset of the change
from review.opendev.org as a patch file.

   $ ./tools/download_gerrit_change.py --help
   Usage: download_gerrit_change.py [OPTIONS] GERRIT_CHANGE

   Options:
     -o, --output_patch TEXT  Output patch file  [default: stdout]
     -g, --gerrit_url TEXT    The url to Gerrit server  [default:
                              https://review.opendev.org/]
     -t, --timeout INTEGER    Timeout, in seconds  [default: 10]
     --help                   Show this message and exit.

   $ ./tools/download_gerrit_change.py 698863 -o /tmp/change.patch
   $ ./tools/files_in_patch.py /tmp/change.patch
   networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
   networking_ovn/ml2/trunk_driver.py
   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py
   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py

3) migrate_names.py
Use this tool to modify the name of the files in a patchfile so it can
be converted to/from the legacy networking-ovn and neutron repositories.

   $ ./tools/migrate_names.py --help
   Usage: migrate_names.py [OPTIONS]

   Options:
     -i, --input_patch TEXT    input_patch patch file or gerrit change
     -o, --output_patch TEXT   Output patch file. Default: stdout
     -m, --mapfile PATH        Data file that specifies mapping to be applied to
                               input  [default: /home/user/openstack/neutron.git
                               /tools/migrate_names.txt]
     --reverse / --no-reverse  Map filenames from networking-ovn to Neutron repo
     --help                    Show this message and exit.
   $ ./tools/migrate_names.py -i 701646 > /tmp/ovn_change.patch
   $ ./tools/migrate_names.py -o /tmp/reverse.patch -i /tmp/ovn_change.patch --reverse
   $ diff /tmp/reverse.patch /tmp/ovn_change.patch | grep .py
   < --- a/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py
   < +++ b/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/mech_driver.py
   > --- a/networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
   > +++ b/networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
   <... snip ...>

   $ ./tools/files_in_patch.py /tmp/ovn_change.patch
   networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py
   networking_ovn/ml2/trunk_driver.py
   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_mech_driver.py
   networking_ovn/tests/unit/ml2/test_trunk_driver.py

Change-Id: I17904c996e1357f7292d25aab4d448edb052f44c
Related-Blueprint: neutron-ovn-merge

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-28 16:02:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Prometheus template generation

In a deployment where Prometheus is enabled and
Alertmanager is disabled the task "Copying over
prometheus config file" in
'ansible/roles/prometheus/tasks/config.yml' will
fail to template the Prometheus configuration file
'ansible/roles/prometheus/templates/prometheus.yml.j2'
as the variable 'prometheus_alert_rules' does not
contain the key 'files'. This commit fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Idbe1e52dd3693a6f168d475f9230a253dae64480
Closes-Bug: #1854540
(cherry picked from commit 991bdc5f558467403cc3d993ba5c53b5f89272f9)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Prometheus template generation

In a deployment where Prometheus is enabled and
Alertmanager is disabled the task "Copying over
prometheus config file" in
'ansible/roles/prometheus/tasks/config.yml' will
fail to template the Prometheus configuration file
'ansible/roles/prometheus/templates/prometheus.yml.j2'
as the variable 'prometheus_alert_rules' does not
contain the key 'files'. This commit fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Idbe1e52dd3693a6f168d475f9230a253dae64480
Closes-Bug: #1854540
(cherry picked from commit 991bdc5f558467403cc3d993ba5c53b5f89272f9)

commit_message:
Fix Prometheus template generation

In a deployment where Prometheus is enabled and
Alertmanager is disabled the task "Copying over
prometheus config file" in
'ansible/roles/prometheus/tasks/config.yml' will
fail to template the Prometheus configuration file
'ansible/roles/prometheus/templates/prometheus.yml.j2'
as the variable 'prometheus_alert_rules' does not
contain the key 'files'. This commit fixes this bug.

Change-Id: Idbe1e52dd3693a6f168d475f9230a253dae64480
Closes-Bug: #1854540
(cherry picked from commit 991bdc5f558467403cc3d993ba5c53b5f89272f9)

commit_message:
Remove libvirt package

Nova services are now running in the containers but we still have
libvirt packages installed on Overcloud systems. This change removes
libvirt packages that are not needed any more.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/681092
Change-Id: I1220eda28cb8d21098c26aa548305004567e6e03
Closes-Bug: 1842932

commit_message:
Increase sleep in health_check in case of DBConnectionError

To avoid false failover of amphorae by healthmanager during db
outage increase time of sleep.

Story: 2007197
Task: 38360

Change-Id: I8e03858e32b6c220ce08fe418a613a6c32fe064c

commit_message:
WIP: Enable commpression for collect logs in testenvs

Goals is to:

* remove the call of collect_logs.sh script and calling the
role directory
* assure that all functionality from collect_logs.sh is done by the role

Change-Id: I956db84602964f5d64707e27d3e5a340c7a6bc17

commit_message:
Ensure python versions

It looks like better to specify basepython for all tox envs.
As of the rocky release, we use python 2.7 by default.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-November/010957.html

Change-Id: I38ffc08e9a03d93e9072ac718ad2865db4f8fcab

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-28 12:13:09.000000000', 'message': 'Trigger nova-compute restart when amqp has changed

If nova-compute is contected to the message broker before
the nova-conducter then it times out after a minute and shutsdown.
The nova-cloud-controller needs to inform the nova-compute charm
to restart nova-compute when it is connected to the message broker.
The restart is limited to the leader to stop multiple restart
requests.

Change-Id: Icdf47ea80267d421ca14f131f2d1f7cbdeb73641
Closes-Bug: #1861094
'}]
commit_message:
Trigger nova-compute restart when amqp has changed

If nova-compute is contected to the message broker before
the nova-conducter then it times out after a minute and shutsdown.
The nova-cloud-controller needs to inform the nova-compute charm
to restart nova-compute when it is connected to the message broker.
The restart is limited to the leader to stop multiple restart
requests.

Change-Id: Icdf47ea80267d421ca14f131f2d1f7cbdeb73641
Closes-Bug: #1861094

commit_message:
Keep connection backrefs with weakref.proxy

We're storing references to the connection object on
proxy objects and the senlin folks are seeing memory
leaks. Storing them in weakrefs.

Change-Id: Ie0cffc402747d070c1eae1d9b423a046936d917d
(cherry picked from commit 0e8e36163716a53b4c1c2931408ced72951513be)

commit_message:
Allow to evacuate without specifying a target host

When the evacuate is run without specifying a target host, horizon
sets an empty string for target host. But the evacuate api doesn't
allow an empty string. As a result, nova returns "HTTP 400 Bad
request".

So this patch sets None as the target host when it isn't specified.

Closes-Bug: 1793694
Change-Id: I32c1e75e4d71d88b98599c6fb0647fc3ac3d6736
(cherry picked from commit f9e0f8a976b82088ef095a69cd1fa892cddde3ba)

When the evacuate is run without specifying a target host, horizon

Tested in Ie2e2a4dc31b9fdcd6ac87c14f564621803c8d4cf and passing https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/7b28328004ed4ca1997e3bd1936c07aa'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-01-16 04:17:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I don't mind this here, but if others disagree fixup_stuff might be another location for it"}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2020-01-16 05:59:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

If you only need this for one experimental nova job, can't you simply install the new repo in the pre phase of that job?"}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2020-01-16 09:27:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> If you only need this for one experimental nova job, can't you

commit_message:
libvirt: Support the use of the virt-preview repo when using Fedora

The virt-preview repo provides the latest rawhide versions of QEMU,
Libvirt and other virt tools for older releases of Fedora. This repo is
extremely useful when testing features in OpenStack that rely on these
latest builds well in advance of them landing in full Fedora, CentOS or
RHEL releases.

This change adds a ``ENABLE_FEDORA_VIRT_PREVIEW_REPO`` configurable
to control when this repo is enabled and used when deploying on Fedora.

Change-Id: I5c3e1b7b632fd73310c462530990cdb0e0c0ceea

Can you bit elaborate us. What exactly you want here?"}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2017-10-05 08:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> (1 comment)
>Also concerned about setting delete_ts to 0, which would lost the 
>information that the account was undeleted. checking the code at >[1], it seems we can safely keep the delete timestamp untouched.

As we have analyzed the source code behaviour for Account Creation and Account Deletion the fields for "time stamp" and "status" are getting changed:
1) During Account Creation the following fields updated:
a) delete_timestamp with 0
b) created_at with timestamp
c) put_timestamp with timestamp
d) status_changed_at with timestamp
e) status with blank

2) During Account Deletion the following fields updated:
a) delete_timestamp with timestamp
b) status with "DELETED"
c) status_changed_at with timestamp

We thought that if we are undeleting the account then the following fields should be updated: 
a) deleted_timestamp with 0
b) status_changed_at with timestamp
c) put_timestamp with timestamp
d) status with blank'}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2017-10-05 10:46:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > IMHO, the default delay_reaping must be updated to make this
 > feature useful on a default deployment.

> I'm expecting that a meta will be stored. So having a non-meta
> header would feel more appropriate to me.

We have introduced the meta in header to differentiate between the normal operation and the undelete operation.

If we would store this meta rather than providing into the header then where we need store it?"}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2017-10-05 10:48:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> (8 comments)

> I think it's safe to *replace* most of the above steps with your > procedure.

from line number 262 to 359?'}, {'account_id': 860, 'date': '2017-10-05 13:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

We will analyse the required changes here to accommodate the delay_reaping."}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2017-10-06 08:12:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > swift/account/server.py
 > > Line 150:
 > > should it check delay_reaping and refuse to undelete if it's
 > > too late? once the >reaper started, i'm not sure it will stop
 > > if account is undeleted, which can create >confusion for users
 > > that would see objects disapearing after undeletion

As we have analysed the account reaper behaviour, we have verified it by the changing the following key in account-server.conf file.

1) Changed the value of interval to 60 seconds under [account-reaper] section In account-server.conf .

2) Keep the default value of delay_reaper to 0 under [account-reaper] section In account-server.conf .

Steps executed:
===============
Step1: Executed the account-reaper service.
Step2: Delete the account by executing the curl command.
Step3: Verified that reaper has deleted all the containers and objects from that account.
Step4: Execute the curl command to undelete the account, account get successfully undeleted with no containers and objects.

Please confirm what exactly you want here to handle the delay_reaper?"}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2017-10-09 08:04:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

> Step4: Execute the curl command to undelete the account, account
 > get successfully undeleted with no containers and objects.
 
That's the issue I think. There is no point in having undeletion if some or all objects are lost. And, once undeletion is started, it won't be stopped before all objects are deleted, so even if undeleted, user would lost all objects.

I feel like the delay_reaper should be set to a reasonable default (7 days?), and that undeletion should only be allowed before that delay is passed. So, when user undeleted an account, no objects were already lost."}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2017-10-10 10:23:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > Step4: Execute the curl command to undelete the account, account
 > > get successfully undeleted with no containers and objects.
 > 
 > That's the issue I think. There is no point in having undeletion if
 > some or all objects are lost. And, once undeletion is started, it
 > won't be stopped before all objects are deleted, so even if
 > undeleted, user would lost all objects.
 > 
 > I feel like the delay_reaper should be set to a reasonable default
 > (7 days?), and that undeletion should only be allowed before that
 > delay is passed. So, when user undeleted an account, no objects
 > were already lost.

Thanks for the suggestion.

After analyzing your suggestion for delay_reaper, we have derived the following understanding:

We will introduce some checks before going to undelete the account and the check would validate as like following:

1)Calculate current time (e.g. 1507586442.98)
2)Extract the delete_timestamp of the account (e.g. 1506983453.43)
3)Extract the value of delay_reaping from configuration file (e.g. 604800 (7 days in seconds))
4)Compare it as like below:
(1) (2) < (3) 

e.g. 1507586442.98 -  1506983453.43 <  604800
e.g. 602991.86 < 604800
i.e. TRUE, then the deleted account will be undeleted otherwise it won뗪."}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2017-10-11 10:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-11 15:44:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

tests failures are real... the problem is the account server can't always read the reaper config... take a look at how the object-auditor handles ValueError and IOError when the config-file/section isn't available.

Ideally you want to have an explicit option for the account server, preferably lifting the single documented option up to DEFAULT where it's available to all the services that need it.  Then the access to the other config section implicitly is just a best-effort for transparent upgrade.

If you need some more details try to catch up with me via IRC in #openstack-swift on freenode."}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2017-10-12 06:05:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > tests failures are real... the problem is the account server can't
 > always read the reaper config... take a look at how the
 > object-auditor handles ValueError and IOError when the
 > config-file/section isn't available.
 > 
 > Ideally you want to have an explicit option for the account server,
 > preferably lifting the single documented option up to DEFAULT where
 > it's available to all the services that need it.  Then the access
 > to the other config section implicitly is just a best-effort for
 > transparent upgrade.
 > 
 > If you need some more details try to catch up with me via IRC in
 > #openstack-swift on freenode.

Thanks Clay for your valuable inputs.

We would like to ask the following:

1) If we lift up the delay_reaping to DEFAULT section of the configuration file then it would be accessible from the DEFAULT section always.

2) The other section named [account-reaper] which consist of this key (i.e. delay_reaping) in account-server.conf but not in account-server\1.conf to 4.conf (these files only has the empty section named as [account-reaper]). 

3) If we would add this key in DEFAULT section, then this will lead the duplicate key in configuration files and user need to set the value on two places. If we go with this approach, then what will be name of key and the following configuration files should also be updated here:
a) /etc/account-server.conf-sample (this will be used as account-server.conf in actual)
b) /doc/saio/swift/account-server/1.conf
c) /doc/saio/swift/account-server/2.conf
d) /doc/saio/swift/account-server/3.conf
e) /doc/saio/swift/account-server/4.conf

4) If we would be adding this key in DEFAULT section of all the configuration files, then where to update in the documentation side.

Please confirm."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2017-10-12 18:35:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hope this clears things up!  Sorry i missed you on IRC, but I'm sure anyone who's around in #openstack-swift could help explain the pattern we use for moving config options up to DEFAULT (e.g. reclaim_age, rsync_timeout) - just point them at this change.

> 1) If we lift up the delay_reaping to DEFAULT section of the configuration file
> then it would be accessible from the DEFAULT section always.
That sounds great!  Anytime we need a single option in multiple services we
move it to the DEFAULT, e.g. bind_port.

> 2) The other section named [account-reaper] which consist of this key (i.e.
> delay_reaping) in account-server.conf but not in account-server\1.conf to
> 4.conf (these files only has the empty section named as [account-reaper]). 
The example configs document all the options, the saio configs are minimal
configs - any options ommited use the default docuemnted values.

> 3) If we would add this key in DEFAULT section, then this will lead the
> duplicate key in configuration files and user need to set the value on two
> places. If we go with this approach, then what will be name of key and the
> following configuration files should also be updated here:
>     a) /etc/account-server.conf-sample (this will be used as account-server.conf in actual)
>     b) /doc/saio/swift/account-server/1.conf
>     c) /doc/saio/swift/account-server/2.conf
>     d) /doc/saio/swift/account-server/3.conf
>     e) /doc/saio/swift/account-server/4.conf
You should *move* the option from [account-reaper] to [DEFAULT]
/etc/account-server.conf-sample - changing the example config won't have any
effect on deployed clusters..  Since the saio configs currently omit the option
you don't need to change anything in the example saio configs.

> 4) If we would be adding this key in DEFAULT section of all the configuration
> files, then where to update in the documentation side.
You would document the change in multiple places, the commit message should
explain the change and be flagged UpgradeImpact.  And any docs for the
account-server.conf should reflect the change:

 * /etc/account-server.conf-sample
 * doc/source/deployment_guide.rst
 * doc/manpages/account-server.conf.5

But you can *also* add some code for backwards compatibility.  But the code
must be robust against failure.  The account server should first and foremost
try to get the value of the option from it's config (probably coming from
[DEFAULT] section if the deployment is following the docs).  If it can't find
the value in it's config, only then would it *try* to read the [account-reaper]
section, but if that fails for any reason it should assume the default value."}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2017-10-16 08:16:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2017-10-17 09:42:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2017-10-17 19:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Works like a champ! As an admin, I do a

 $ curl -H 'x-auth-token: <admin token>' $OS_STORAGE_URL -X DELETE
 > DELETE /v1/AUTH_test HTTP/1.1
 ...
 < HTTP/1.1 204 No Content
 ...

...and then as a user all I get back is

 $ curl -H 'x-auth-token: <user token>' $OS_STORAGE_URL
 > GET /v1/AUTH_test HTTP/1.1
 ...
 < HTTP/1.1 410 Gone
 ...

User can't revive it:

 $ curl -H 'x-auth-token: <user token>' $OS_STORAGE_URL -X PUT -H 'x-undelete-account: true'
 > PUT /v1/AUTH_test HTTP/1.1
 ...
 < HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden
 ...

But the admin can!

 $ curl -H 'x-auth-token: <admin token>' $OS_STORAGE_URL -X PUT -H 'x-undelete-account: true'
 > PUT /v1/AUTH_test HTTP/1.1
 ...
 < HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted
 ...

And then everything's back to normal:

 $ curl -H 'x-auth-token: <user token>' $OS_STORAGE_URL
 > GET /v1/AUTH_test HTTP/1.1
 ...
 < HTTP/1.1 200 OK
 ...

A few more thoughts, though:

It might be worth including an UpgradeImpact, since we're both relocating a config option and updating its default. For operators that currently explicitly set the option, what should they do here? Update config and then upgrade, I'm assuming? Out of curiosity, what are the consequences of doing it in the wrong order?

What happens when at least one account server misses the X-Undelete-Account request? Are we relying on replication to make sure it eventually gets in sync before it starts reaping? Or does the reaper try to get consensus and refuse to do anything unless it knows that the other replicas agree that the account should be deleted? This might be a good opportunity for a probe test...

I think once we resolve

- the deployment guide comment (pretty sure that was just choosing the wrong side of a merge conflict),
- what to tell operators who are upgrading, and
- better restrictions on who can revive an account

...I'll be at least +1; I'll feel even better once we

- have a probe test,
- refuse to start with bad configs, and
- recommend GET instead of PUT for checking the recently-deleted status

...but maybe we could do those as follow-ups?"}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2018-01-08 06:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

(11 comments)

Please provide the views over the added inline comments.'}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2018-01-30 10:32:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Reviewers, Please provide the suggestions on the follow-up questions asked by us.'}, {'account_id': 26690, 'date': '2018-02-05 06:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

commit_message:
Add ability to undelete an account.

Implemented the fix to support the feature of undeleting the
account which was marked for deletion for the reaper.

Change-Id: Ib537065a88ba3b7d97235d74cf8bcae465ccf055
Closes-Bug: #1521351

commit_message:
Revert "confluent-kafka 1.3.0 fails to install"

The missing wheels have been published on Jan 8, 2020.

https://pypi.org/project/confluent-kafka/#files

This reverts commit 9987b849df85bf40e5698dc52e29bd3f21d5464a.

Change-Id: I5762673966187239ccbdc021215f158faa9efdf1

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

storlets is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/693631/

Change-Id: I62239e865d2938f0fc7dc2755156206b29095524

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-27 22:44:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix role_assignments role.id filter

Without this patch, if there are multiple role assignments on the system
and they are not all the same role, querying for role assignments with
/v3/role_assignments?role.id={role_id} may leak some role assignments
that don't match the role_id, making the returned results incorrect.
This patch fixes the issue by using a list comprehension instead of a
for loop over a list that was being modified within the loop.

Change-Id: Icfce3b14abb55c6fef3de1b314cee22fc8b1d08c
Closes-bug: #1858012
(cherry picked from commit c2d88306621f890a857acd6831ea8bf073f55537)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix role_assignments role.id filter

Without this patch, if there are multiple role assignments on the system
and they are not all the same role, querying for role assignments with
/v3/role_assignments?role.id={role_id} may leak some role assignments
that don't match the role_id, making the returned results incorrect.
This patch fixes the issue by using a list comprehension instead of a
for loop over a list that was being modified within the loop.

Change-Id: Icfce3b14abb55c6fef3de1b314cee22fc8b1d08c
Closes-bug: #1858012
(cherry picked from commit c2d88306621f890a857acd6831ea8bf073f55537)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-30 20:36:01.000000000', 'message': 's3api: Implement versioning status API

Set up versioning for a container and return the status of versioning.

When deleting buckets, also try to delete the +versioning bucket.

Store version id when copying object to archive

When the current object is deleted and the versioning mode is set to
"stack", an older object from the archive container is restored as the
current object.  The "version id" is only part of the object name when
it is in the archive container, which means that when it becomes the
current object, the "version id" is lost.  swift3 needs to know the
version id even after it is restored, but right now there is no way to
get the version id.

This change stores the version id as metadata
"X-Object-Sysmeta-Version-Id" when an object is copied to the archive
container and given a version id.

s3api: Modify obj GETorHEAD to support versions

If a versionId is given, if it is "null", it must be the current object.
If the versionId is not null, it might be in the versioning container,
or it might be the current object that had that version id that was
restored after an object has been deleted.

s3api: Listing of versioned objects

When processing GET requests for buckets with "?versions", in addition
to listing what is currently in the bucket, also return the objects that
are in the versioning container.

Add X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override

swift3 needs both the stack mode delete and history mode delete.  When
an object without specifying a "versionId" is deleted, swift3 uses the
history mode delete, which means the object is marked as deleted and
returns 404.  When an object with a specific "versionId" is deleted and
that object is the current object, swift3 uses the stack mode delete,
which means the most recent non-deleted object in the versioning
container becomes the current object.  Right now, swift only supports
setting the mode once and using it to determine the behavior of the
deletion.

Adding X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override allows swift3 to override the
stored versioning mode for one request.  This means that even if the
versioning mode is set to "history", if the request has the header
"X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override: stack", swift will use "stack" as
the versioning mode.

s3api: Delete versioned objects

When deleting an object with a specified version, and it is in the
versioning container, it is deleted permanently.  If it is the current
version, then the object is deleted and the next available object in the
versioning container becomes the current object.

Change-Id: I8296681b61996e073b3ba12ad46f99042dc15c37
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-08-27 16:58:11.000000000', 'message': 's3api: Implement versioning status API

Set up versioning for a container and return the status of versioning.

When deleting buckets, also try to delete the +versioning bucket.

current object.  The "version id" is only part of the object name when
it is in the archive container, which means that when it becomes the
current object, the "version id" is lost.  swift3 needs to know the
version id even after it is restored, but right now there is no way to
get the version id.

This change stores the version id as metadata
"X-Object-Sysmeta-Version-Id" when an object is copied to the archive
container and given a version id.

If a versionId is given, if it is "null", it must be the current object.
If the versionId is not null, it might be in the versioning container,
or it might be the current object that had that version id that was
restored after an object has been deleted.

"X-Backend-Versioning-Mode-Override: stack", swift will use "stack" as
the versioning mode.

s3api: Delete versioned objects

When deleting an object with a specified version, and it is in the
versioning container, it is deleted permanently.  If it is the current
version, then the object is deleted and the next available object in the
versioning container becomes the current object.

Change-Id: I8296681b61996e073b3ba12ad46f99042dc15c37
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-09-11 05:09:43.000000000', 'message': 's3api: Implement versioning status API

Set up versioning for a container and return the status of versioning.

When deleting buckets, also try to delete the +versioning bucket.

s3api: Modify obj GETorHEAD to support versions

If a versionId is given, if it is "null", it must be the current object.
If the versionId is not null, it might be in the versioning container,
or it might be the current object that had that version id that was
restored after an object has been deleted.

s3api: Listing of versioned objects

When processing GET requests for buckets with "?versions", in addition
to listing what is currently in the bucket, also return the objects that
are in the versioning container.

s3api: Delete versioned objects

When deleting an object with a specified version, and it is in the
versioning container, it is deleted permanently.  If it is the current
version, then the object is deleted and the next available object in the
versioning container becomes the current object.

Change-Id: I8296681b61996e073b3ba12ad46f99042dc15c37
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>

'}, {'created': '2019-11-22 20:51:08.000000000', 'message': 's3api: Implement object versioning API

Translate AWS S3 Object Versioning API requests to native Swift Object
Versioning API, speficially:

 * bucket versioning status
 * bucket versioned objects listing params
 * object GETorHEAD & DELETE versionId
 * multi_delete versionId

Change-Id: I8296681b61996e073b3ba12ad46f99042dc15c37
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>

commit_message:
s3api: Implement object versioning API

Translate AWS S3 Object Versioning API requests to native Swift Object
Versioning API, speficially:

 * bucket versioning status
 * bucket versioned objects listing params
 * object GETorHEAD & DELETE versionId
 * multi_delete versionId

Change-Id: I8296681b61996e073b3ba12ad46f99042dc15c37
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-20 15:06:59.000000000', 'message': 'Handle cell failures in get_compute_nodes_by_host_or_node

get_compute_nodes_by_host_or_node uses the scatter_gather_cells
function but was not handling the case that a failure result
was returned, which could be the called function raising some
exception or the cell timing out. This causes issues when the
caller of get_compute_nodes_by_host_or_node expects to get a
ComputeNodeList back and can do something like len(nodes) on it
which fails when the result is not iterable.

To be clear, if a cell is down there are going to be problems
which likely result in a NoValidHost error during scheduling, but
this avoids an ugly TypeError traceback in the scheduler logs.

Change-Id: Ia54b5adf0a125ae1f9b86887a07dd1d79821dd54
Closes-Bug: #1857139

which fails when the result is not iterable.

To be clear, if a cell is down there are going to be problems
which likely result in a NoValidHost error during scheduling, but
this avoids an ugly TypeError traceback in the scheduler logs.

exception or the cell timing out. This causes issues when the
caller of get_compute_nodes_by_host_or_node expects to get a
ComputeNodeList back and can do something like len(nodes) on it
which fails when the result is not iterable.

To be clear, if a cell is down there are going to be problems
which likely result in a NoValidHost error during scheduling, but
this avoids an ugly TypeError traceback in the scheduler logs.

commit_message:
Handle cell failures in get_compute_nodes_by_host_or_node

get_compute_nodes_by_host_or_node uses the scatter_gather_cells
function but was not handling the case that a failure result
was returned, which could be the called function raising some
exception or the cell timing out. This causes issues when the
caller of get_compute_nodes_by_host_or_node expects to get a
ComputeNodeList back and can do something like len(nodes) on it
which fails when the result is not iterable.

To be clear, if a cell is down there are going to be problems
which likely result in a NoValidHost error during scheduling, but
this avoids an ugly TypeError traceback in the scheduler logs.

Change-Id: Ia54b5adf0a125ae1f9b86887a07dd1d79821dd54
Closes-Bug: #1857139

commit_message:
Ensure bootstrap handles multiple roles with the same name

The bootstrap logic doesn't take into consideration multiple roles
with the same name. If bootstrap is unable to determine which role to
use and accidentally uses a domain-specific role with the same name
as a default role, bootstrap will fail in unexpected ways.

Closes-Bug: 1856881
Change-Id: Iddc364d8c934b6e54d1e8c75b8b159faadbf865d
(cherry picked from commit 25cf359e5fb914b855922121f20e23bd14626b8e)

[{'created': '2020-01-02 23:52:07.000000000', 'message': "DVR: Ignore DHCP port during DVR host query

For large scale deployment, the dvr router will be installed to
the scheduled DHCP host. This will definitely increase the l3
agent service pressure, especially in large number of concurrent
updates, creation, or agent restart.

This patch adds a config ``host_dvr_for_dhcp`` for the DHCP port
device_owner filter during DVR host query. Then if we set
``host_dvr_for_dhcp = False``, L3-agent will not host the DVR router
namespace in its connected networks' DHCP agent hosts.

Closes-Bug: #1609217

commit_message:
DVR: Ignore DHCP port during DVR host query

For large scale deployment, the dvr router will be installed to
the scheduled DHCP host. This will definitely increase the l3
agent service pressure, especially in large number of concurrent
updates, creation, or agent restart.

This patch adds a config ``host_dvr_for_dhcp`` for the DHCP port
device_owner filter during DVR host query. Then if we set
``host_dvr_for_dhcp = False``, L3-agent will not host the DVR router
namespace in its connected networks' DHCP agent hosts.

Closes-Bug: #1609217
Change-Id: I53e20be9b306bf9d3b34ec6a31e3afabd5a0fd6f
(cherry picked from commit 8f057fb49ac637bd0dbf60ca07b89f0e4a59c7b7)

commit_message:
Add a note to the part power increase documentation

Specify that the relink command must be run as the same user than the
daemon processes to avoid creating files that are not manipulable by the
server/replicator/...

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-10 08:11:27.000000000', 'message': "[L3] Switch order of processing added and removed router ports

It may happend that one router's port is going to be
removed and another one (same IP but new subnet) is going to be added
to the router in short time.
That can lead to the problem that IP which is allocated to the new
port is not added to keepalived's vips list because same IP address
is already in this list (this exising IP address belongs to old port).
But few seconds later old port is removed and finally router ends
up with new port configured without IP address.

To avoid such case, this patch switches order of processing new
and deleted ports in _process_internal_ports() method in RouterInfo
class.
So now first old ports will be removed and than new ports will be
configured so there will be no case when IP address is already added
to VIPs list when it is going to be removed in few seconds.

Change-Id: I72dc4a06a806731ec5124fa11c9f69c7dd6cbbb0
Closes-Bug: #1857021
(cherry picked from commit 3faba7cae0c5f0b8ac93c025ca057e2f533445cf)
"}, {'created': '2020-01-16 14:02:14.000000000', 'message': "[L3] Switch order of processing added and removed router ports

It may happend that one router's port is going to be
removed and another one (same IP but new subnet) is going to be added
to the router in short time.
That can lead to the problem that IP which is allocated to the new
port is not added to keepalived's vips list because same IP address
is already in this list (this exising IP address belongs to old port).
But few seconds later old port is removed and finally router ends
up with new port configured without IP address.

To avoid such case, this patch switches order of processing new
and deleted ports in _process_internal_ports() method in RouterInfo
class.
So now first old ports will be removed and than new ports will be
configured so there will be no case when IP address is already added
to VIPs list when it is going to be removed in few seconds.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/702868
Change-Id: I72dc4a06a806731ec5124fa11c9f69c7dd6cbbb0
Closes-Bug: #1857021

commit_message:
[L3] Switch order of processing added and removed router ports

It may happend that one router's port is going to be
removed and another one (same IP but new subnet) is going to be added
to the router in short time.
That can lead to the problem that IP which is allocated to the new
port is not added to keepalived's vips list because same IP address
is already in this list (this exising IP address belongs to old port).
But few seconds later old port is removed and finally router ends
up with new port configured without IP address.

To avoid such case, this patch switches order of processing new
and deleted ports in _process_internal_ports() method in RouterInfo
class.
So now first old ports will be removed and than new ports will be
configured so there will be no case when IP address is already added
to VIPs list when it is going to be removed in few seconds.

Change-Id: I72dc4a06a806731ec5124fa11c9f69c7dd6cbbb0
Closes-Bug: #1857021
(cherry picked from commit 3faba7cae0c5f0b8ac93c025ca057e2f533445cf)

[{'created': '2020-01-07 21:55:12.000000000', 'message': 'Complete overcloud deploy --baremetal-deployment

The overcloud deploy --baremetal-deployment argument is an alternative
to calling the provision and unprovision commands separately, giving
users the option of only needing to call overcloud deploy to also

- calls undeploy_roles after the heat stack operation, to unprovision

argument is passed (which is not documented in stable/train)

(cherry picked from commit 69aad030d3e1808826ddda37ab47290d1925b6fe)
'}]
commit_message:
Complete overcloud deploy --baremetal-deployment

The overcloud deploy --baremetal-deployment argument is an alternative
to calling the provision and unprovision commands separately, giving
users the option of only needing to call overcloud deploy to also
manage baremetal.

This change does the following:
- adds the missing plan argument to deploy_roles to support
  multi-overcloud
- calls undeploy_roles after the heat stack operation, to unprovision
  any nodes that are flagged as provisioned:false

This is a medium-risk backport because overcloud deploy is frequently
run, but the code-path is only used when the --baremetal-deployment
argument is passed (which is not documented in stable/train)

Blueprint: nova-less-deploy
Change-Id: Ia4d064d7b039ef3afcee38de8ad1aa47f035a263
(cherry picked from commit 69aad030d3e1808826ddda37ab47290d1925b6fe)

- prompt user to confirm unprovision, overridable with --yes argument
- add an -all argument which will unprovision all nodes in the yaml,

  support multiple overcloud stacks

This is a low-risk backport as the unprovision command is unused in
stable/train.

Blueprint: nova-less-undercloud

Change-Id: I25c5311ec3599e0de9bd87038366ed8c7d7896a2
(cherry picked from commit 4a568fd7ea36907911452bc8ed3c094c5274d98e)

commit_message:
Improvements to unprovision command

- print a table of baremetal nodes which are about to be unprovisioned
- prompt user to confirm unprovision, overridable with --yes argument
- add an -all argument which will unprovision all nodes in the yaml,
  instead of just the provisioned:false nodes.
- add the missing plan argument to the provision deploy_roles to
  support multiple overcloud stacks

This is a low-risk backport as the unprovision command is unused in
stable/train.

Blueprint: nova-less-undercloud

Change-Id: I25c5311ec3599e0de9bd87038366ed8c7d7896a2
(cherry picked from commit 4a568fd7ea36907911452bc8ed3c094c5274d98e)

commit_message:
Add doc for supported OpenStack release & py version

Tempest is branchless and support many OpenStack stable branches
and python versions. Users of Tempest should have a clear doc about
what all openstack releases and python versions are supported.

Change-Id: Idc76e07efdd3710a59c773c564ca532419989ed5

Maybe you could be interested by this patch[1] which is adding the extra_vars support.
This new parameter accepts either a Dict or the absolute path of a JSON|YAML file.

this will need a rebase in order to be landed'}, {'account_id': 25877, 'date': '2020-01-27 17:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Patch Set 21 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-27 22:50:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-01-28 21:43:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

> (1 comment)

Unfortunately we've not figured out how to keep both v1 and v2 active at the same time; it seems osc wants only one active api and our client plugin doesn't seem to provide for version switching. We could update the v1 backup command and tests in-place, and then push the v2 migration to a follow-on review?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-28 21:51:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I guess we can go with this. I think you'd have to add some python code to go back to execute the previous version. For example a new --legacy option that would just invoke the v1 code in take_action.  I was just thinking it would be nice to allow a fallback if we ultimately find issues with this code but still want to offer a legacy way of invoking for this cycle.  

I'm of the opinion that we need to cut these over similar to how we did the undercloud switch where we use a cli command argument as a feature flag that allowed for additional testing without breaking the world. I'm not aware of CI jobs for this that could exercise that functionality but it might be beneficial for some of the other functions."}]

commit_message:
Move undercloud backup from mistral to ansible

This playbook reflects the same behaviour as the mistral workbook
of the same name and adds functionality discussed on this external
bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1659888

This also adds a --save-swift parameter (default false)
that makes the backup be saved on swift otherwise it will
be saved on the filesystem.

Depends-On: I309d52eb424a73bd04af167a2a7411ba3bf35674
Change-Id: I054a805e820087a30bd8d27a0b460b6e519849ac
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

subject: Drop Django 1.11 support

All installation of lower-constraints.txt should have "==" rather than ">=".

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/7d90d2b813a74750883864d134e3cce7/log/tox/lower-constraints-1.log#94

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-06 01:53:43.000000000', 'message': 'Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2. requirements.txt and
lower-constraints.txt are updated accordingly. for more info. please
refer [1].
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: Icfa76c6d916af4548059a44704972877ad457e2f
'}, {'created': '2020-01-06 02:27:02.000000000', 'message': 'Drop Django 1.11 support

Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2. requirements.txt and

commit_message:
Drop Django 1.11 support

Django 1.11 ends its extended support in April 2020 (which is before
Ussuri release), so horizon drops Django 1.11 support in Ussuri.

tox envs for non-primary Django versions are no longer needed in tox.ini
as testing environments for non-primary Django versions are setup in
the zuul jobs now.

horizon>=17.1.0 is required to use Django 2.2. requirements.txt and
lower-constraints.txt are updated accordingly. for more info. please
refer [1] [2].
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700733/
[2] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/Enable_Django22_support_in_Horizon_Plugin

Change-Id: Icfa76c6d916af4548059a44704972877ad457e2f

commit_message:
Remove _get_trunks method for openstacksdk client.

We already bumped version of openstacksdk, so now we can get all trunk
ports without any hacks. This patch is fixing it.

Change-Id: I766024502b23f46c42b985d00616cdd0bb442123

commit_message:
Add promote-governance-election job

This job publishes the election site under the
governance.openstack.org AFS volume.  This is our "next generation"
publishing as it doesn't rely on storing things on a single static
server.  The current job, promote-tox-docs-static, will be removed
after we transition to serving the site from AFS.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/704702
Change-Id: If666499149c80e2194c33dfd17d115f39f2280bf

commit_message:
Add audit database user for audit purposes

This commit adds an audit user to the postgresql database which
will have only SELECT privileges on the postgresql database tables.
This is accomplished by setting up audit user creation parameters
in the Patroni bootstrap environment settings, according to (1).

(1) https://patroni.readthedocs.io/en/latest/ENVIRONMENT.html

Change-Id: Idf1cd90b5d093f12fa4a3c5c794d4b5bbc6c8831

subject: s3api: Better handle 498/429 responses
messages: [{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-05 17:54:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-01-28 17:55:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-05 17:54:02.000000000', 'message': "s3api: Better handle 498/429 responses

Currently, they just 500 as an unexpected response status. Much better
would be S3's '503 Slow Down' response.

Of course, that's all dependent on where you place ratelimit in your
pipeline -- and we haven't really given clear guidance on that. I'm not
actually sure you *want* ratelimit to be after s3api and auth... but if
you *do*, let's at least handle it gracefully.

Change-Id: I36f0954fd9949d7d1404a0c381b917d1cfb17ec5
Related-Bug: 1669888
"}]
commit_message:
s3api: Better handle 498/429 responses

Currently, they just 500 as an unexpected response status. Much better
would be S3's '503 Slow Down' response.

Of course, that's all dependent on where you place ratelimit in your
pipeline -- and we haven't really given clear guidance on that. I'm not
actually sure you *want* ratelimit to be after s3api and auth... but if
you *do*, let's at least handle it gracefully.

Change-Id: I36f0954fd9949d7d1404a0c381b917d1cfb17ec5
Related-Bug: 1669888

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-24 09:11:20.000000000', 'message': 'Agent liveness - allow time to propagate checks

Right now neutron-server bumps the nb_cfg parameter in NB_Global
table which needs to be propagated by northd to SB_Global,
processed by agents, and write it back into SB_Global.
This requires processing by neutron-server but unfortunatelly
the server checks straight away and many times the value read
is behind the expected value.

All this results in frequent false positives showing dead agents
when they are not.

This patch is relaxing the checks by allowing a difference of 1
between the read and expected values.

Change-Id: Ic850665bde77c6891691e831317a0ec320ed197b
Backported-From: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703612/
Closes-Bug: 1860436
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-01-24 09:32:05.000000000', 'message': 'Agent liveness - allow time to propagate checks

Right now neutron-server bumps the nb_cfg parameter in NB_Global
table which needs to be propagated by northd to SB_Global,
processed by agents, and write it back into SB_Global.
This requires processing by neutron-server but unfortunatelly
the server checks straight away and many times the value read
is behind the expected value.

All this results in frequent false positives showing dead agents
when they are not.

This patch is relaxing the checks by allowing a difference of 1
between the read and expected values.

Change-Id: Ic850665bde77c6891691e831317a0ec320ed197b
Backported-From: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703612/
Closes-Bug: 1860436
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Agent liveness - allow time to propagate checks

Right now neutron-server bumps the nb_cfg parameter in NB_Global
table which needs to be propagated by northd to SB_Global,
processed by agents, and write it back into SB_Global.
This requires processing by neutron-server but unfortunatelly
the server checks straight away and many times the value read
is behind the expected value.

All this results in frequent false positives showing dead agents
when they are not.

This patch is relaxing the checks by allowing a difference of 1
between the read and expected values.

Change-Id: Ic850665bde77c6891691e831317a0ec320ed197b
Backported-From: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703612/
Closes-Bug: 1860436
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

subject: container-puppet: create containers sequentially to avoid race
messages:
[{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-12-18 18:40:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-12-18 18:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

This review is a more invasive approach than [1]. It aims at conserving concurrency of image pull and puppet runs, while creating containers sequentially to avoid the racy container creation.
So no noticeable slowdown as opposed to [1].

[1] I29a9ffc621bcbd5e1b09490c5fe09a363286bb8b.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-12-19 10:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-12-19 20:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-12-20 08:21:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-12-20 14:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-12-20 17:50:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

rdo-check'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2019-12-20 17:50:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-28 15:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Do we still need this with 1.6.4?'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-01-28 22:11:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> Do we still need this with 1.6.4?

No we don't indeed, I'll abandoning it. Thanks for pointing that out"}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-01-28 22:12:29.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Newer podman doesn't suffer that race, so no need to make things more complex. Abandoning this review accordingly"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-18 18:40:32.000000000', 'message': 'container-puppet: create containers sequentially to avoid race

Due to a race in podman 1.6.3, when containers are created in
parallel under high disk IO, their associated overlayFS mount point
might become invalid, and container-puppet would fail to run.

In order to avoid the bug, create the docker-puppet containers
sequentially to prevent any race, and make then run in detached
mode, concurrently. This way, we keep honouring the concurrency
setting for image download and puppet run, so we do not degrade

commit_message:
container-puppet: create containers sequentially to avoid race

Due to a race in podman 1.6.3, when containers are created in
parallel under high disk IO, their associated overlayFS mount point
might become invalid, and container-puppet would fail to run.

In order to avoid the bug, create the docker-puppet containers
sequentially to prevent any race, and make then run in detached
mode, concurrently. This way, we keep honouring the concurrency
setting for image download and puppet run, so we do not degrade
run time overall.

Change-Id: I3fd9b8f8ee131c5b2118d922b7756a7572c09108
Closes-Bug: #1856324

commit_message:
Ensure driver error preventing trunk port deletion is logged

When trunk port deletion is attempted but fails because the driver does
not permit it, the logs do not contain the driver error message that
specifies the precise rationale for preventing the trunk port deletion.
Log it explicitly.

Change-Id: I7ed1a742849dfce9e65b8eb36566112501fb0e39

[{'created': '2020-01-07 19:21:25.000000000', 'message': 'Make tests pass in 2022

Background:
As part of my work on reproducible builds for openSUSE, I check that software still gives identical build results in the future.
The usual offset is +15 years, because that is how long I expect some software will be used in some places.
This showed up failing tests in our package build.
See https://reproducible-builds.org/ for why this matters.

This makes it expire 1 year in the future to model realistic tokens.

Change-Id: I73bde68be53afff4e8dff12d756b8381f34b2adb
(cherry picked from commit 4a4c96ce9b28ed54f93a21ca405c5b34ef3c3429)

1. fixed the hadcoded token expiration date in
keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/client_fixtures.py. This is using the same

2. fixed bandit complains in keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_request.py.
The request environment variable names are not tokens. We'll need to

Change-Id: I73bde68be53afff4e8dff12d756b8381f34b2adb
