commit_message:
NUMA rebuild tests

This patch does the following:
1. Introduce NUMA Rebuild test based on following feature [1]:
   Rebuild server with NUMATopologyFilter enabled fails (in some cases)
   Related upstream commits [2-5]

2. Make _get_db_numa_topology a public function

3. Add a new config option db in whitebox-database section, which
   defaults to 'nova_cell1' for devstack job

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1804502
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698260/
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674072/
[4] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689861/
[5] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/687957/

Change-Id: I02e8a6c066ba624134d881f52cceb9c605b5c62f

commit_message:
Use correct pip executable for mixed distro/source installs

Ubuntu does not package tempest plugins so even for a distro
install the plugins are installed using pip. We must use the correct
pip executable when installing the plugins for py3 environments.

Change-Id: Ib399176ad12d556790daf770f11e7e8e14c3fd98

'}, {'created': '2020-01-10 09:59:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multiple issues with MariaDB handling

These affected both deploy (and reconfigure) and upgrade
resulting in WSREP issues, broken deploys or need to
recover the cluster.

This patch makes sure k-a does not abruptly terminate
nodes to break cluster.
This is achieved by cleaner separation between stages
(bootstrap, restart current, deploy new) and 3 phases
for restarts (to keep the quorum).

Upgrade actions, which operate on a healthy cluster,
went to its section.

Service restart was refactored.

We no longer rely on the master/slave distinction as
all nodes are masters in Galera.

Closes-bug: #1857908
Closes-bug: #1859145
Change-Id: I83600c69141714fc412df0976f49019a857655f5

commit_message:
Fix multiple issues with MariaDB handling

These affected both deploy (and reconfigure) and upgrade
resulting in WSREP issues, failed deploys or need to
recover the cluster.

This patch makes sure k-a does not abruptly terminate
nodes to break cluster.
This is achieved by cleaner separation between stages
(bootstrap, restart current, deploy new) and 3 phases
for restarts (to keep the quorum).

Upgrade actions, which operate on a healthy cluster,
went to its section.

Service restart was refactored.

We no longer rely on the master/slave distinction as
all nodes are masters in Galera.

Closes-bug: #1857908
Closes-bug: #1859145
Change-Id: I83600c69141714fc412df0976f49019a857655f5

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

sahara plugins do works with python 3 and the sahara core
does not support python 2.7 anymore anyway.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Also:
- bump the lower-constraints decorator requirements to a recent one
  to prevent failures;
- drop the obsolete jenkins tox target.

Change-Id: I5806dcb8f13e88a28c0b5e6de449efa9b95b6e73

commit_message:
Do not print large usage message for port or weight

The entire port and/or weight range was being printed, which
can be very long, instead just print it in short hand.

Also fixed port range verification to be from 0-65535, was
treating 65535 as invalid.

Change-Id: I26feca15836f110d3db0854262c83ed1765ec12f
Story: 2007218
Task: 38470

commit_message:
link introspection API docs to client docs

The introspection API documentation does not include any detail at all
about the payload returned. That information is in the
ironic-python-agent documentation instead. Add a link to that location
to make it easier for someone trying to find out what introspection
data is returned to do so.

Change-Id: I972803ac700f25823ac6715d21dda09ebe40e307
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Start installing DIB from Zuul-cloned sources in the CI

We need to be able to pick up fixes quicker than now and to use
depends-on with DIB changes. This change achieves it.

Change-Id: I70f2e13f799cc496878afd2d1416b50386dd0123

commit_message:
Don't require root partition when installing a whole disk image

With the change to find the bootloader on disk (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696914/)
install_bootloader should now be invoked when doing an iscsi_deploy even if the root
partition cannot be found.

Depends-On: I7167e71e5d2352a045565289b200e5530d0ba11d

commit_message:
cinder: Add encrypted volumes resources

This change adds some basic coverage for attaching and detaching an
encrypted LUKS volume during an upgrade. To keep things readable a new
_wait_for_volume_update utility function is introduced and called
throughout the cinder tests when waiting for a volume to switch state or
to become bootable.

Change-Id: I894ef91a1e38775b1b56feb84612c7661046b4ba

DevStack.

commit_message:
Follow up to root device hints in instance_info

Follow-up to commit 42dc9787e52670bb1e1baa36f08703dd802804f4:
* Refactor root device checking code to be in one place and extend
  the error message.
* Extend unit tests to cover the actual override.
* Update documentation.

Change-Id: I1d73f2233c766ff52268e242b8071dec12b2daca

commit_message:
Remove libvirt packaged dependencies

Nova services are now running in the containers but we have still
a lot of libvirt packages installed on Overcloud systems.
To delete unnecessary packages on host systems I'm removing following
dependencies:
* modifying NovaLibvirtGuests service to run in containers and generate
  config files for libvirt-guests
* removeing hard dependencies for libvirt-guests service to
  virt-guest-shutdown.target.
  packages.

Change-Id: I2d0557127f88a492b283897767e57ea126adfe83
Closes-Bug: 1842932
(cherry picked from commit 42eb7c98b6d124a4a3c711cf8da217f75a1d1163)

commit_message:
Remove libvirt package

Nova services are now running in the containers but we still have
libvirt packages installed on Overcloud systems. This change removes
libvirt packages that are not needed any more.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/702836
Change-Id: I1220eda28cb8d21098c26aa548305004567e6e03
Closes-Bug: 1842932
(cherry picked from commit 359bc74c7602b27a803039557c9c5767e2bf0df6)

commit_message:
Add explicit admin user to Patroni

In this PS we explicitly define the admin user rather than letting
patroni use the default username and password.

Change-Id: I9885314902c3a60e709f96e2850a719ff9586b3d

> (1 comment)

The question is, should we include deployment host to image pruning? The operator may have docker registry on it, so maybe useful or maybe not. I'm not certain, its open for discussion."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-01-27 09:30:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

> The question is, should we include deployment host to image
 > pruning? The operator may have docker registry on it, so maybe
 > useful or maybe not. I'm not certain, its open for discussion.

You are on the deployment host so you can issue docker commands directly there. Also, it might *not* have docker installed and then the play will fail. Only baremetal are guaranteed to have docker.

Well, I hope you are convinced now. :-)"}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-01-27 10:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-01-27 10:50:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2020-01-27 11:25:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-01-27 11:27:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16:

maybe we could followup with tests? for example running this after upgrades :-)'}, {'account_id': 30523, 'date': '2020-01-27 11:37:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

 > upgrades :-)

commit_message:
Adds Docker image pruning command

This change introduces prune-images command.

Uses docker_prune module of Ansible that comes with version 2.8.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/699333/

Implements: blueprint docker-image-pruning

Change-Id: Icbf374dd50e1cc1f1604bb4fa779b34279efd50c

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints everywhere in ironic installation

Currently a few packages are installed without it, pulling in undesired
updates (e.g. cryptography 2.8 on stable/steain). This change fixes it.

The --upgrade and --force-reinstall flags are removed from all pip calls
since they're not compatible with using upper-constraints.

The explicit installation of pyOpenSSL is removed, >= 18.0 is anyway
used by Rocky and newer. A few explicit usages of -c argument are
also removed in favour of the implicit handling in pip_install.yml.

NOTE: the stable backport adds ansible_python_interpreter variable to
      test-bifrost.sh to make sure the correct python is used.

Conflicts:
        playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/install.yml
	playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/pip_install.yml

Squashed with another commit to make the CI pass:
    Use upper-constraints for ironicclient, sushy and DIB

Change-Id: Ic776cb2ec0779c9b324e94bf387ee4f3f857cd72
(cherry picked from commit 70786915db901e80f8ebd40baa07931fea78459a)
(cherry picked from commit 564de9d264bf41bc1fa66cc82ba8fa132cd0f63f)

NOTE: the stable backport adds ansible_python_interpreter variable to
      test-bifrost.sh to make sure the correct python is used.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/install.yml

Change-Id: Ic776cb2ec0779c9b324e94bf387ee4f3f857cd72
(cherry picked from commit 70786915db901e80f8ebd40baa07931fea78459a)
"}]
commit_message:
Use upper-constraints everywhere in ironic installation

Currently a few packages are installed without it, pulling in undesired
updates (e.g. cryptography 2.8 on stable/steain). This change fixes it.

The --upgrade and --force-reinstall flags are removed from all pip calls
since they're not compatible with using upper-constraints.

The explicit installation of pyOpenSSL is removed, >= 18.0 is anyway
used by Rocky and newer. A few explicit usages of -c argument are
also removed in favour of the implicit handling in pip_install.yml.

NOTE: the stable backport adds ansible_python_interpreter variable to
      test-bifrost.sh to make sure the correct python is used.

Conflicts:
	playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/tasks/install.yml

Change-Id: Ic776cb2ec0779c9b324e94bf387ee4f3f857cd72
(cherry picked from commit 70786915db901e80f8ebd40baa07931fea78459a)

commit_message:
Clarify introspection failed attempt log message

This change clarifies that an introspect attempt failed, implying that
a future attempt might succeed.

This is part of a fix for transient failures when calling
ironic-inspector leading to logging indicating introspection failed
when it actually succeeded.

The layout of the message is also changed slightly to make Kibana
searches for failures easier.

Change-Id: Icef88c3ae33fe4516b3cadd64240cc882434e690
Partial-Bug: #1854399

commit_message:
Set Ansible default version to 2.8

Ansible 2.6 is EOL, we should move to a more recent release that
has better support for Python 3.x and, above all, is maintained
with security and critical bug fixes.

Change-Id: I6aa80b4bc4a0c34ac919951cd940b2fc6b736bdc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-11 18:21:12.000000000', 'message': 'Add Task Monitor support for async operations

Redfish services that support asynchronous operations implement the
Task service, Task resource, and Task Monitor. When performing long
running update operations, the service returns a status of 202
Accepted. When returning a status code of 202, the response includes
a Location header containing the URL of the Task Monitor. The response
may also include the Retry-After header to specify the amount of time
the client should wait before querying the operation status.

The Task Monitor is an opaque URL that the client can query via a GET
request. While the async operation is still in progress, the service
returns a 202 Accepted status. The body of the response may be a Task
resource or it may be empty.

Once the operation completes, a GET on the Task Monitor will return a
status that indicates the result of the operation (e.g., 200, 201,
4XX).

A new TaskMonitor class is added to represent the Task Monitor and
give the sushy user the ability to monitor the status of an async
operation.

The Volume and VolumeCollection classes are also updated to take
advantage of the Task Monitor when performing the initialize_volume()
and create_volume() methods respectively. Other sushy resource classes
can be similarly updated as needed in future updates.

Change-Id: Ice6700806710f37b590f6b879ec38656326b39c6
Story: 2003514
Task: 30719

commit_message:
Add Task Monitor support for async operations

Redfish services that support asynchronous operations implement the
Task service, Task resource, and Task Monitor. When performing long
running update operations, the service returns a status of 202
Accepted. When returning a status code of 202, the response includes
a Location header containing the URL of the Task Monitor. The response
may also include the Retry-After header to specify the amount of time
the client should wait before querying the operation status.

The Task Monitor is an opaque URL that the client can query via a GET
request. While the async operation is still in progress, the service
returns a 202 Accepted status. The body of the response may be a Task
resource or it may be empty.

Once the operation completes, a GET on the Task Monitor will return a
status that indicates the result of the operation (e.g., 200, 201,
4XX).

A new TaskMonitor class is added to represent the Task Monitor and
give the sushy user the ability to monitor the status of an async
operation.

The Connector class is updated allow an option to make HTTP requests
blocking. This change utilizes the newly added TaskMonitor.

Change-Id: Ice6700806710f37b590f6b879ec38656326b39c6
Story: 2003514
Task: 30719

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

sahara plugins do works with python 3 and the sahara core
does not support python 2.7 anymore anyway.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:

commit_message:
Use upper-constraints everywhere in ironic installation

Currently a few packages are installed without it, pulling in undesired
updates (e.g. cryptography 2.8 on stable/steain). This change fixes it.

The --upgrade and --force-reinstall flags are removed from all pip calls
since they're not compatible with using upper-constraints.

The explicit installation of pyOpenSSL is removed, >= 18.0 is anyway
used by Rocky and newer. A few explicit usages of -c argument are
also removed in favour of the implicit handling in pip_install.yml.

Change-Id: Ic776cb2ec0779c9b324e94bf387ee4f3f857cd72

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

sahara plugins do works with python 3 and the sahara core
does not support python 2.7 anymore anyway.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ie5dfe4de57d86280493d6f4f062fb0e18ecd43c9

[{'created': '2020-01-06 12:54:45.000000000', 'message': 'zuul: Avoid duplicated job

Currently openstack-tox-py36/37 jobs use Django 2.2.
horizon-non-primary-django-jobs template just runs Django 2.2 test.
These two are duplicated.

To keep the zuul project template (as it is used in horizon plugins),
a job in openstack-python3-ussuri-jobs is specified in the template.
Zuul allows to specify a job in multiple places, so it should work.

Change-Id: I248ac27b60836ce0da473f452ce017542139c671
'}]
commit_message:
zuul: Avoid duplicated job

Currently openstack-tox-py36/37 jobs use Django 2.2.
horizon-non-primary-django-jobs template just runs Django 2.2 test.
These two are duplicated.

To keep the zuul project template (as it is used in horizon plugins),
a job in openstack-python3-ussuri-jobs is specified in the template.
Zuul allows to specify a job in multiple places, so it should work.

Change-Id: I248ac27b60836ce0da473f452ce017542139c671

in case we run periodic jobs in vexxhost we should use

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-14 13:23:40.000000000', 'message': 'Handle incomplete messages in MessageRegistry

Some messges in the MessageRegistry are not having fields like
'Description' and 'Severity'. Most of the time the string in
'Message' and 'Description' fields are same. This fix proposes
to make 'Description' as not-required field and setting the
'Severity' field to default value of 'Warning' if its missing
in the messages of MessageRegistry.

Example of a message in MessageRegistry in ProLiant Gen10 servers
"UpdateFailed": {
  "Message": "The update failed with a component specific error (%1).",
  "NumberOfArgs": 1,
  "ParamTypes": [
    "string"
  ],
  "Resolution": "Retry the update after remedying the component error."
}

Change-Id: I3e9e2ee0867f59684c24e60772a5318801891521
'}, {'created': '2020-01-22 04:08:02.000000000', 'message': 'Handle incomplete messages in MessageRegistry

in the messages of MessageRegistry.

commit_message:
Handle incomplete messages in MessageRegistry

Some messges in the MessageRegistry are not having fields like
'Description' and 'Severity'. Most of the time the string in
'Message' and 'Description' fields are same. This fix proposes
to make 'Description' as not-required field and setting the
'Severity' field to default value of 'CRITICAL' if its missing
in the messages of MessageRegistry.

Example of a message in a MessageRegistry
"UpdateFailed": {
  "Message": "The update failed with a component specific error (%1).",
  "NumberOfArgs": 1,
  "ParamTypes": [
    "string"
  ],
  "Resolution": "Retry the update after remedying the component error."
}

Story: 2007216
Task: 38467
Change-Id: I3e9e2ee0867f59684c24e60772a5318801891521

commit_message:
WIP: Update haproxy reload commands

Now that haproxy is containerized, we should reload the haproxy
service by restarting the container. This commit does that by reusing
an existing tool we have to reload haproxy.

Change-Id: I70b6abab837011ae1857e49aefd42b23016e9f08

commit_message:
Use print function

In py3 usage of print as a fucntion instead of a stetement is a
hard requirement. This patch fixes symlink of python ceph libraries.

Change-Id: I07db988f607b8f4ab041437edff2903a8e07e381
(cherry picked from commit b9610ff808381319644cbcd84229b239f54435b8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-23 08:48:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add a validation to fail if a Ceph dependency is not installed

When the overcloud is deployed with Ceph we need to install all the
ceph dependencies on the overcloud nodes.
If a ceph dependency is missing, a warning message is displayed and we
can also let the playbook fail setting the related boolean.
Furthermore, if the package is found, the playbook check if a new
version is available.

Closes-Bug: 1855692
Change-Id: I85d09955e839bab35cc06d2f0906f3012c8a1aa9
(cherry picked from commit 7fe786039b77c03fdd984e161b7aeccb78be9f1e)

commit_message:
Execute healthchecks as root

Some containers doesn't have the "default" user set to root (which is
good). This lead to healthcheck_port() function to return a message
because the non-root user isn't allowed to call "ss" command as itself.

Ensuring we're running the healthchecks as root will also allow to stop
duplicating some commands, making them faster and smaller for the
system.

This was discovered and discussed on Red Hat bugzilla first, then ported
to Launchpad.

This patch is the port of I2e49d4dd5b385237f4f79929c70365424f6fa22d to
tripleo-ansible "container-manage" role.

Change-Id: I0e6883cd86157b73f18ab63f96f633a8a05e82bf
Related-Bug: 1860569
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1778881

commit_message:
nova-net: Remove remaining nova-network quotas

The 'security_group_rules' [1], 'floating_ips' [2], 'fixed_ips' [3] and
'security_groups' [4] quotas are all nova-network only and can be
removed or, more specifically, set to unlimited and ignored until we
eventually bump our minimum API microversion.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/477700
[2] https://review.opendev.org/457862
[3] https://review.opendev.org/457861
[4] https://review.opendev.org/457860

Change-Id: I9a5362fdf29e3680c59f620c585f3d730e4f6adb
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

The vpnaas rootwrap filters are out of date and therefore not
functional on the latest release of OpenStack Ansible.

This updates and adds all the missing ones so that it becomes
functional again.

Change-Id: Iadcb4c7451cd51526dfd96b305a9d0b1948ce8da
(cherry picked from commit 6ab3f196883b83bec284363b87fe5d1d1d831bb5)
'}]
commit_message:
Update vpnaas rootwrap filters

The vpnaas rootwrap filters are out of date and therefore not
functional on the latest release of OpenStack Ansible.

This updates and adds all the missing ones so that it becomes
functional again.

Change-Id: Iadcb4c7451cd51526dfd96b305a9d0b1948ce8da
(cherry picked from commit 6ab3f196883b83bec284363b87fe5d1d1d831bb5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-29 11:56:53.000000000', 'message': "Define new 'ipv6-only' jobs for monasca-api in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' (adding
in Depends-On patch) which will deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'congress-tempest-ipv6-only'
run on gate which is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'monasca-tempest-python3-influxdb-ipv6-only' and
  'monasca-tempest-python3-cassandra-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35906

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/671231/

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I5321064901de8ddb7f4730f6b8cb2a48ffc08718

This commit adds the new job 'monasca-tempest-influxdb-ipv6-only'
and 'monasca-tempest-cassandra-ipv6-only' and run on gate which
is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'monasca-tempest-influxdb-ipv6-only' and
  'monasca-tempest-cassandra-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

commit_message:
[train][goal] Define new 'ipv6-only' jobs for monasca-api in gate

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
Tempest has defined the base job 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' which will
deploy services on IPv6.

This commit adds the new job 'monasca-tempest-influxdb-ipv6-only'
and 'monasca-tempest-cassandra-ipv6-only' and run on gate which
is derived from 'devstack-tempest-ipv6'.

Verification structure will be:
- 'devstack-IPv6' deploy the service on IPv6
- 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' run will verify the IPv6-only setting and listen address
- 'monasca-tempest-influxdb-ipv6-only' and
  'monasca-tempest-cassandra-ipv6-only' will run the tests.

Story: #2005477
Task: #35906

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/ipv6-support-and-testing.html

Change-Id: I5321064901de8ddb7f4730f6b8cb2a48ffc08718

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-25 09:52:48.000000000', 'message': "spec update: virtual persistent memory

Keep the spec consistent with real implementation. The VPMEM feature is
Libvirt and QEMU specific now,so the original design about data model is
deprecated. New 'resources' field is introduced to store different kind of
specific resources, we move to using it to enable virtual persistent memory
in Nova. Besides, we give up vpmem data migrating during resize.

Change-Id: I370a8e299319234bf78e728db4ad3e83df81cbd0
"}]
commit_message:
spec update: virtual persistent memory

Keep the spec consistent with real implementation. The VPMEM feature is
Libvirt and QEMU specific now,so the original design about data model is
deprecated. New 'resources' field is introduced to store different kind of
specific resources, we move to using it to enable virtual persistent memory
in Nova. Besides, we give up vpmem data migrating during resize.

Change-Id: I370a8e299319234bf78e728db4ad3e83df81cbd0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-02 13:57:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for global_request_id

Added support for setting global_request_id on a Connection.
If done, this will cause all requests sent to send the request id
header to the OpenStack services. Since Connection can otherwise
be used multi-threaded, add a method global_request that returns
a new Connection based on the old Connection but on which
the new global_request_id has been set. Since a Connection
can be used as a context manager, this also means the global_request
method can be used in with statements.

Change-Id: I70964cdd79741703c0b9b911b3b2f27c248130f0
(cherry picked from commit 95bf14908e528c9817a73d5e854061d632fa9f3a)
'}, {'created': '2020-01-03 18:26:53.000000000', 'message': "Add fake support for global_request_id

Subsequent releases of openstacksdk added support for setting
global_request_id, which some tools ended up using. However,
it's not supported across the board and using older versions
of things for stable releases gets broken.

Add support for allowing people to set global_request_id but
don't actually do anything with it to maintain forwards
and backward compat.

Change-Id: I70964cdd79741703c0b9b911b3b2f27c248130f0
"}, {'created': '2020-01-03 18:27:26.000000000', 'message': "Add fake support for global_request_id

Change-Id: I70964cdd79741703c0b9b911b3b2f27c248130f0
"}, {'created': '2020-01-26 09:24:53.000000000', 'message': "Add fake support for global_request_id

Subsequent releases of openstacksdk added support for setting
global_request_id, which some tools ended up using. However,
it's not supported across the board and using older versions
of things for stable releases gets broken.

Add support for allowing people to set global_request_id but
don't actually do anything with it to maintain forwards
and backward compat.

Change-Id: I70964cdd79741703c0b9b911b3b2f27c248130f0
"}]
commit_message:
Add fake support for global_request_id

Subsequent releases of openstacksdk added support for setting
global_request_id, which some tools ended up using. However,
it's not supported across the board and using older versions
of things for stable releases gets broken.

Add support for allowing people to set global_request_id but
don't actually do anything with it to maintain forwards
and backward compat.

Change-Id: I70964cdd79741703c0b9b911b3b2f27c248130f0

commit_message:
Add proxy support to Vagrantfile

The creation of Development environments behind a corporate network
can result in the addition of proxy setup. This change pretends to
simplify that setup.

Change-Id: I6e698ba7a10789145ffc6a9b6325464ea76895e3

commit_message:
Make volume soft delete more thorough

When a volume record is soft-deleted in the database,
dependent records in other tables (for example,
Transfers, VolumeGlanceMetadata, etc.) must be soft
deleted as well.  Otherwise, we will get FK dependency
errors when the database is purged.

This patch adds that support for VolumeAttachment table.
(other tables were already covered, just refactored)

Also adds tests.

Co-authored-by: Rajat Dhasmana <rajatdhasmana@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Brian Rosmaita <rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ibfa6c4ba2f162681756ec3203991351345b65346
Related-Bug: #1542169
(cherry picked from commit a5bb17bdfc8af4df08ccce759bedcfd16bc7fe15)
(cherry picked from commit dd2ba4900473869ef393b40d6a4b2ec6f7b035ac)

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: Ibe2d0b4bcda8cdab215a27b30bf75b6cdbed8011

commit_message:
Adjust images in the docs and other small fixes

* Some ".. image:" RST directives changed to ".. figure:" where
  it's more suitable.
* All images moved to subfolder where they're used
* Fixed indentation in the Workflow Language specification
* Other minor changes in docs

commit_message:
Remove Horizon tempest plugin from master

Horizon tempest tests is runned against puppet-horizon
in standalone job. It needs to be unskipped so that it should
run there.

Change-Id: I1fd455600f317b8be35dd80d0c29f3c092abd8bb
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-11-29 08:22:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing ExecReload in container service unit file

It may happen that we want to just reload the container. Before this
patch, it was a "stop and start", while podman has the "podman kill"
available, accepting the HUP signal.

Doing so allows other automated tools to actually just "reload" the
container as we would do for a standard service.

Change-Id: I5946a36e56dd1f3b49104deaef4ab69bada8e264
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing ExecReload in container service unit file

It may happen that we want to just reload the container. Before this
patch, it was a "stop and start", while podman has the "podman kill"
available, accepting the HUP signal.

Doing so allows other automated tools to actually just "reload" the
container as we would do for a standard service.

Change-Id: I5946a36e56dd1f3b49104deaef4ab69bada8e264

'2019-11-14 02:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: Code-Review-1 (1 comment) Please update to the latest swiftclient patch https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691877/ and carefully review this gist: https://gist.github.com/clayg/8bbe43b6b244138d23fdf3255008af3d I'm having an ugly failure mode when doing concurrent versioned deletes I'd like to suggest the swift object-versioning behavior when doing a versioned delete of the most recent version should be to FIRST cleanup the static link (leaving you with a tombstone, which seems obvious and defensible) - then we could punt down to only s3api to have the weird kludge of "popping" the next oldest version after the fact simply by "repairing" a symlink to the next latest object "by hand" if necessary for compatibility... although I'd be somewhat surprised if clients relied on this unexpected behavior.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-11-14 23:15:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 29: Patch Set 28 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-11-14 23:21:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29: Yeah... we kinda always knew concurrent version-aware deletes would be a bear -- whether that came from swift's bulk middleware, or s3api's multi-delete, or just a bunch of client connections (whether swift or S3). How crazy would it be to attempt the repair on subsequent GETs? Catch the 409, see that it's a versioning link, do a listing to try to suss out the actual state of the system... and issue either a PUT or DELETE to get things back on track..."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-11-15 00:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30: Patch Set 29 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-11-15 06:43:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30: I'm interested in a request that would make a staticlink point to an arbitrary version, it's going to end up looking a lot like a create static link request, with a pre-flight HEAD to check existence and get details like etag, size & content-length"}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-11-19 18:05:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 33.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-11-19 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 47.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-11-27 18:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 48.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-11-28 04:11:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-12-03 15:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: Code-Review-1 -Workflow I think we made the right call to support versioned listing on unversioned containers, but we should also support the reasonable versioned operations for version_id = null vagrant@saio:~$ swift list foo --json --versions [ { "bytes": 9, "content_type": "application/octet-stream", "hash": "e55cedc11adb39c404b7365f7d6291fa", "is_latest": true, "last_modified": "2019-12-03T15:41:17.128780", "name": "test", "version_id": "null" } ] vagrant@saio:~$ swift delete foo test --version-id=null Error Deleting: foo/test: Object DELETE failed: http://saio:8080/v1/AUTH_test/foo/test?version-id=null 412 Precondition Failed [first 60 chars of response]

Precondition Failed

A precondition for this GET works just fine: vagrant@saio:~$ swift download foo test --version-id=null -o - awesome2'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2019-12-04 05:46:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 48: (5 comments) Loving the new API, still working through the code and playing with it in a SAIO as I read. Awesome job guys. I'm about to head out to dinner (with the visiting in-laws) so will push up my questions, comments and NITs as I have them. Still reading so some I'll probably get around to answering myself :P"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2019-12-04 05:47:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: Code-Review-1 forgot to add my current vote. But awesome start.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-12-04 06:16:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 48: @clay, I'm not able to reproduce the error you saw with `swift delete foo test --version-id=null`. In my test if the container is versioned then the symlink only is deleted and if the container is unversioned, then the object is deleted. Is it possible you were testing against and older patchset? GET/HEAD works as you mentioned. For PUT it returns a 400 for either versioned/unversioned containers. It's possible to get a different response body depending if the PUT had a body or not, so I'm not super happy about that bit"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-12-04 18:48:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: -Code-Review (1 comment) @Thiago - yeah, i get the 412 when I also have x-history-location turned on... vagrant@saio:~$ swift stat fuz Account: AUTH_test Container: fuz Objects: 1 Bytes: 9 Read ACL: Write ACL: Sync To: Sync Key: X-History-Location: fuz_archive Accept-Ranges: bytes X-Storage-Policy: default Last-Modified: Wed, 04 Dec 2019 18:20:02 GMT X-Timestamp: 1575483485.21019 X-Trans-Id: tx1d3070393974445eb2e10-005de7fa82 Content-Type: application/json; charset=utf-8 X-Openstack-Request-Id: tx1d3070393974445eb2e10-005de7fa82 vagrant@saio:~$ swift delete fuz test --version-id null Error Deleting: fuz/test: Object DELETE failed: http://saio:8080/v1/AUTH_test/fuz/test?version-id=null 412 Precondition Failed [first 60 chars of response]

Precondition Failed

A precondition for this vagrant@saio:~$ swift delete fuz test test vagrant@saio:~$ swift list fuz_archive --json [ { "bytes": 9, "content_type": "application/octet-stream", "hash": "e55cedc11adb39c404b7365f7d6291fa", "last_modified": "2019-12-04T18:28:45.308460", "name": "004test/1575483568.25094" }, { "bytes": 0, "content_type": "application/x-deleted;swift_versions_deleted=1", "hash": "d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e", "last_modified": "2019-12-04T18:28:45.365300", "name": "004test/1575484125.36414" } ] So it's more complicated than I thought, maybe 400 *is* the correct response to version'd requests against legacy versions'd containers.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-04 23:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: How does this interact with container-sync? IIRC, it expects to just sync symlinks over directly... so I guess it tries to drop a static symlink into the null namespace and fails with a 409?'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2019-12-06 08:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: (4 comments) review part 2 of probably a few more to come. Sorry. This is an awesome feature, and I want to review it carefully. So will continue to review more and more when I find pieces of spare time. Great work on this peeps.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-06 18:21:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: (5 comments) Sorry; wrote a conflict in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/697581/'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-12-09 08:41:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 48: (9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-12-09 09:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 49.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-12-16 04:20:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 50.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-12-16 06:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 51.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-12-16 18:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 51: Code-Review-1 Still a few things to address: 1) container stat bytes/object count shows different #'s that account list 2) symlink=get on versioned static link exposes null namespace 3) i can't seem to create a static link to "a manifest in a versioned container" (I *can* create static links in a versioned container to objects in a versioned container, and static links to manifests in an unversioned containers) So, I'd like to go ahead and start digging into these - I'll see if anything else pops up.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-12-16 20:59:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 52.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-12-16 21:00:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 52: Code-Review-1 my new tests probalby fail on py3, and I haven't fixed the account listing stats yet"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-17 01:30:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 52: Code-Review-1 (34 comments) Going through my old review comments. Still want to look a little harder at reversed version-aware listings and trying to clean up a versions container when the base request to enable versioning fails... see https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682382/6..52/swift/common/middleware/versioned_writes/object_versioning.py@a868 Still concerning: * https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682382/52/test/functional/test_object_versioning.py@143 - func tests busted * https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682382/6/swift/common/middleware/versioned_writes/object_versioning.py@827 - client can't tell whether versioning is suspended or inactive * https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682382/52/swift/common/middleware/versioned_writes/object_versioning.py@335 - bad expirer interactions * https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682382/52/swift/common/middleware/versioned_writes/object_versioning.py@1207 - more than one latest version Lower-priority (I think?): * https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682382/52/swift/common/middleware/versioned_writes/object_versioning.py@672 - improve symlink target validation when doing version-aware deletes"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-17 05:52:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 52: (4 comments) A few more thoughts. I'm still worried about the reconciler queue -- and unlike the expirer queue, there isn't a good way to simply prevent it."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2019-12-17 17:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 53.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-18 06:56:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 53: (2 comments) Wait, how'd we manage to avoid touching common/db.py's validate_metadata[0] in either https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682138/ or this? I'm seeing 400s when I go to push shard ranges... Is the versions container going to get properly replicated? Hmm... no... I think it's because we don't quote X-Container-Sysmeta-Shard-Root.... that's not good. I think sharding is currently busted on master for containers with newlines in their names, for example. [0] https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/2.23.0/swift/common/db.py#L882-L885"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-20 07:14:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 53: (2 comments) Sharder needs to use X-Backend-Allow-Reserved-Names when PUT'ing shards, and container backend needs to include allow_reserved=True when calling list_objects_iter in get_objects... Still fighting through writing a probe test :-/"}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2019-12-23 08:18:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 54.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-24 01:51:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 55: Patch Set 54 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-24 08:32:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 56: Patch Set 55 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-26 06:51:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 57: Patch Set 56 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-26 07:14:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 58: Patch Set 57 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-26 21:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 59.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-27 01:14:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 60: Patch Set 59 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-28 06:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 61.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2019-12-28 07:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 61: (9 comments) OK, feeling better and better about the state of this. Still want to look more at reversed version-aware listings, and just version-aware listings *in general*. Probably want some end_marker support, for example, and maybe add a version_end_marker param. I feel like the possible failure scenarios for container creation and deletion are a little hairy -- makes me think we maybe *do* need an account listings fix like in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700411/ before merging. And we need to write down how to get yourself out of the situation where your primary container is deleted but your archive still exists. (Fortunately, I'm pretty sure it's just: re-create the container and enable versioning on it; delete all versions; delete container again. We ought to have a probe test that demonstrates the problem and exercises teh resolution.) Expirer's avoided for now. Reconciler work is under way at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700449/. I'm not sure how to think about container-sync interactions, but the approach over at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698139/ seems best until we have a better idea of how we *want* these two features to interact. Not sure whether getting that squashed in should block a merge or not. Maybe still want some better validation on the links/names we find in some places, though (1) I'm pretty sure it'd require some operator intervention to cause, and (2) it's hard to say what the "right" behavior should be at that point. I'm no longer worried about validate_metadata; my troubles there were definitely a symptom of https://launchpad.net/bugs/1856894 which is addressed in the new parent patch. I was just plain wrong about > Sharder needs to use X-Backend-Allow-Reserved-Names when PUT'ing shards'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-06 07:26:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 62.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-06 10:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 63.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-01-06 16:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 64.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-01-06 19:57:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 65.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-01-06 22:33:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 66.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-01-06 22:55:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 66: (5 comments) Some thoughts on the account listing. I investigated how things behave when you get into the archive-with-no-primary situation... container shows up in account listings (good!) but 404s on GET (expected) and even version-aware listing (less expected?). Creating the container helps, but there are three ways to do that: * Create the container naively, without any versioning headers. Version aware listings start working, but version-aware *object* operations are all blocked. * Create the container with versioning enabled. Everything's pretty much back where you'd want it to be; can list, get old versions, delete them, etc. * Create the container with versioning suspended. Listings work, but object operations are still blocked! Fortunately, you can get from either 1 or 3 back to 2 by enabling versioning, and once you've done that at least once, object operations start working again even when suspended."}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-07 07:55:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 67: Patch Set 66 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-07 08:07:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 68: Patch Set 67 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-01-07 22:58:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 69.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-08 10:03:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 70.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-08 20:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 70: (2 comments) recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-01-08 22:41:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 70: (54 comments) New review-comments high water mark! High-level comments: Still need to play with listings, but I'm getting more and more convinced that the normal, happy path is going to be good. reverse and end_marker params make me worry, but maybe those could be fleshed out as follow-up? Reconciler's good. Sharder's good. Expirer's avoided, but should be good. is_latest is addressed. Account listings could use an orphan indicator. Could maybe use some docs for getting yourself out of the orphan situation. We've got half that probe test; I'll try to poke at the resolution half today. Still want https://review.opendev.org/#/c/698139/ for container-sync; maybe rledisez can spare some cycles to think about it and weigh in. It'd probably be good to poke at how things behave when we *think* versioning's enabled (we've written down the archive location and everything!) but the archive container isn't actually there or not available. Target validation might still be nice; can probably be follow-up. I was getting a little worried about the coverage ratio at https://74a73f8fbcbb5e483e64-c8f1fa3a42531750546fabcdaf4f3d24.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/682382/70/check/swift-tox-py27/14c2ae2/cover/swift_common_middleware_versioned_writes_object_versioning_py.html but I think it'll get a decent bit better just be removing some unused code."}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-13 06:48:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 70: (23 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-13 06:48:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 71.'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-13 18:10:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 71: recheck'}, {'account_id': 9625, 'date': '2020-01-13 20:31:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 71: recheck'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-01-14 20:05:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 71: (8 comments) Nice! 83% coverage up to 94%! I think I still want an orphan indicator in account listings, though -- otherwise, it's easy to think you've cleaned up the account (and there are just some out-of-date rows in the account DB) when you really haven't. Do we want to squash in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/701643/ ? (After fixing my wrong attribute name, of course.)"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-01-14 23:54:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 71: (1 comment) It's a little subtle, but I think this'd make revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-16 15:08:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: New Object Versioning mode

This patch adds a new object versioning mode. This new mode provides
a new set of APIs for users to interact with older versions of an
object. It also changes the naming scheme of older versions and adds
a version-id to each object.

This new mode is not backwards compatible or interchangeable with the
other two modes (i.e., stack and history), especially due to the changes
in the namimg scheme of older version. This new mode will also serve
as a foundation for adding S3 versioning compatibility in the s3api
middleware.

Change-Id: Ic7d39ba425ca324eeb4543a2ce8d03428e2225a1
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>

'}, {'created': '2019-10-19 02:19:57.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: New Object Versioning mode

This patch adds a new object versioning mode. This new mode provides
a new set of APIs for users to interact with older versions of an
object. It also changes the naming scheme of older versions and adds
a version-id to each object.

This new mode is not backwards compatible or interchangeable with the
other two modes (i.e., stack and history), especially due to the changes
in the namimg scheme of older versions. This new mode will also serve
as a foundation for adding S3 versioning compatibility in the s3api
middleware.

Change-Id: Ic7d39ba425ca324eeb4543a2ce8d03428e2225a1
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>

a version-id to each object.

This new mode is not backwards compatible or interchangeable with the
other two modes (i.e., stack and history), especially due to the changes
in the namimg scheme of older versions. This new mode will also serve
as a foundation for adding S3 versioning compatibility in the s3api
middleware.

Change-Id: Ic7d39ba425ca324eeb4543a2ce8d03428e2225a1
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>

'}, {'created': '2020-01-23 05:36:44.000000000', 'message': 'New Object Versioning mode

This patch adds a new object versioning mode. This new mode provides
a new set of APIs for users to interact with older versions of an
object. It also changes the naming scheme of older versions and adds
a version-id to each object.

This new mode is not backwards compatible or interchangeable with the
other two modes (i.e., stack and history), especially due to the changes
in the namimg scheme of older versions. This new mode will also serve
as a foundation for adding S3 versioning compatibility in the s3api
middleware.

Note that this does not (yet) support using a versioned container as
a source in container-sync. Container sync should be enhanced to sync
previous versions of objects.

Change-Id: Ic7d39ba425ca324eeb4543a2ce8d03428e2225a1
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiagodasilva@gmail.com>

commit_message:
New Object Versioning mode

This patch adds a new object versioning mode. This new mode provides
a new set of APIs for users to interact with older versions of an
object. It also changes the naming scheme of older versions and adds
a version-id to each object.

This new mode is not backwards compatible or interchangeable with the
other two modes (i.e., stack and history), especially due to the changes
in the namimg scheme of older versions. This new mode will also serve
as a foundation for adding S3 versioning compatibility in the s3api
middleware.

Note that this does not (yet) support using a versioned container as
a source in container-sync. Container sync should be enhanced to sync
previous versions of objects.

Change-Id: Ic7d39ba425ca324eeb4543a2ce8d03428e2225a1
Co-Authored-By: Clay Gerrard <clay.gerrard@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago da Silva <thiagodasilva@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add network vip mapping into service data

Make it possible to resolve network virtual ips from
within a service template. The data is transported in
the existing ServiceData property wich is wired into
all services.

The data can be consumed in service templates, replacing
the need for hiera interpolation for network virtual ips.

Related: RHBZ#1791338
Closes-Bug: #1860545
Change-Id: I24c239174d8d066bd2cb4300a21fa1d38a3e80cd

* Jobs will deploy all Ceph integrated OpenStack components, i.e.
  cinder, glance, nova, manila
* Will utilize core openstack testing script + test-ceph will
  check Ceph cluster status and simple Manila commands

'}, {'created': '2019-12-16 11:46:31.000000000', 'message': 'CI: Add Ceph-Ansible jobs

* Adding zuul centos-source/ubuntu-source ceph-ansible jobs
* Jobs will deploy all Ceph integrated OpenStack components, i.e.
  cinder, glance, nova, manila
* Will utilize core openstack testing script + test-ceph will
  check Ceph cluster status and simple Manila commands

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/685032

commit_message:
CI: Add Ceph-Ansible jobs

* Adding zuul centos-source/ubuntu-source ceph-ansible jobs
* Jobs will deploy all Ceph integrated OpenStack components, i.e.
  cinder, glance, nova
* Will utilize core openstack testing script

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/685032
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/698301

Implements: blueprint ceph-ansible
Change-Id: I233082b46785f74014177f579aeac887a25b2ae2

subject: Use include_tasks in the storm role
messages:
[{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-01-25 20:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-01-26 08:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

or maybe import_tasks by the looks of it?'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-01-26 08:34:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

also, storm is going to get some testing with monasca scenario: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/KollaAnsibleScenarios'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-01-26 23:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

include_tasks is used everywhere else. Because of that I changed it here to include_tasks as well.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-01-27 07:35:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Well, I would say "mostly everywhere". That said, let's align storm. All bare instances of include_tasks are worthy of import.'}]

commit_message:
Fixes swift-object-expirer for Debian and Ubuntu binary images.

Replaces 'swift-object' package with 'swift-object-expirer' package.

Change-Id: I8fa3fcad88b35743e042d8a62ccee722b08af673
Closes-Bug: #1859607

commit_message:
container-sync: Sync static links similar to how we sync SLOs

This allows static symlinks to be synced before their target. Dynamic
symlinks could already be synced even if target object has not been
synced, but static links previously required that target object existed
before it can be PUT. Now, have container_sync middleware plumb in an
override like it does for SLO.

Change-Id: I3bfc62b77b247003adcee6bd4d374168bfd6707d

commit_message:
Drop z flag on /var/run, it prevents redeployment

This is related to
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1784608

In short, it will mess up selinux labeling for /var/run and it
is likely to break the system.

nope - if the healthchecks are already running with root user, no need to edit sudo|rootwrap :). As said, the proposed solution will allow to drop the duplication in common.sh, which is always nice. revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-22 15:17:19.000000000', 'message': 'Execute healthchecks as root

Some containers doesn't have the "default" user set to root (which is
good). This lead to healthcheck_port() function to return a message
because the non-root user isn't allowed to call "ss" command as itself.

Ensuring we're running the healthchecks as root will also allow to stop
duplicating some commands, making them faster and smaller for the
system.

This was discovered and discussed on Red Hat bugzilla first, then ported
to Launchpad.

Change-Id: I2e49d4dd5b385237f4f79929c70365424f6fa22d
Closes-Bug: 1860569
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1778881
'}]
commit_message:
Execute healthchecks as root

Some containers doesn't have the "default" user set to root (which is
good). This lead to healthcheck_port() function to return a message
because the non-root user isn't allowed to call "ss" command as itself.

Ensuring we're running the healthchecks as root will also allow to stop
duplicating some commands, making them faster and smaller for the
system.

This was discovered and discussed on Red Hat bugzilla first, then ported
to Launchpad.

Change-Id: I2e49d4dd5b385237f4f79929c70365424f6fa22d
Closes-Bug: 1860569
Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1778881

[{'created': '2020-01-23 19:17:48.000000000', 'message': '[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

mistral-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Removing the USE_PYTHON3=True from base job so that it can
keep running  on py3 for < ussuri branches.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I060587c96baba096525211ffccbe29f71b38760d
'}]
commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

mistral-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Removing the USE_PYTHON3=True from base job so that it can
keep running  on py3 for < ussuri branches.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I060587c96baba096525211ffccbe29f71b38760d

commit_message:
Drop Python 2 Support

1. It's Ussuri. We can *finally* stop testing Python 2 [1]. Time to party.
We don't attempt any cleanup but simply stop testing with Python 2,
indicate that we only support Python 3 via 'setup.cfg' and remove any
Python 2 only dependencies.

This should free up a significant amount of resources from the gate and
let us start using Python 3 idioms in our code. Win-win.

2. Cleanup basepython from individual testenv sections

3. From this point on the codebase will be incompatible with python2

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html#python2-deprecation-timeline

Change-Id: Ia08c363263aaa406d0bf55e10ce8258695387578

commit_message:
Remove deprecated "ip floating (pool)/ip fixed *" commands

"ip floating *", "ip floating pool *" and "fixed ip *"
commands have been deprecated for two cycles,
should can be removed in this cycle now

Change-Id: Icda272b065a4171586c1d9dd76291a624e92b893

commit_message:
Add tags filter options to os network list command

This patch adds the following options: '--tag', '--tag-any',
'--no-tag', '--no-tag-any' to os network list command.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I9978dc8c0864f4f4a6ab844b6c1f79e3b4b63786
Partially-Implements: blueprint network-command-options

commit_message:
Correctly  format the empty fields of "openstack network show" o/p.

add new Formatters to correctly format following empty fields.
Format 'availability_zone_hits' and 'description' fields with empty value.

Change-Id: Iafb0da2439e595ceda891d65cfb1ec6a0221afc5
Closes-Bug: #1651725

commit_message:
disable tls for issues in undercloud

Set TLS settings to false in check
undercloud_generate_service_certificate: false
undercloud_enable_swift_encryption: false

Leave TLS settings to true in periodic

Related-Bug: #1860354
Change-Id: I9ec4a22caf97b0f2f410894c7d3b7bdafa2ecd31

commit_message:
Fix branch for stable job testing

In the master branch we pin branches for ourself and os-client-config to
master, we need to use the correct stable branch here instead, otherwise
proposed changes won't get tested at all.

Change-Id: Id67b53e90406dab1b76c64df2c827a309f14a3fa

[{'created': '2019-10-10 07:53:23.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid duplicated maintenance of integration test config

Configurations of the integration tests are maintained both
in horizon.conf and in-code configuration. It is redundant.

Configurations of the integration tests are defined by oslo.config.
We can use default values from them and generate a sample config file
using oslo-config-generator.

commit_message:
Avoid duplicated maintenance of integration test config

Configurations of the integration tests are maintained both
in horizon.conf and in-code configuration. It is redundant.

Configurations of the integration tests are defined by oslo.config.
We can use default values from them and generate a sample config file
using oslo-config-generator.

This commit drops horizon.conf and generates the sample config.
We no longer have horizon.conf, so the logic to load the config files
is updated accordingly.

Also makes the usage of single and double quotes in config.py consistent.

Change-Id: Id16c9fd4114316ade63c74097e486623d0c5be9f

In L3 agent's rootwrap filters there are KillFilters
to allow killing of python processes (used to kill
neutron-keepalived-state-change-monitor script). There
was also filter for python3.5 but now Neutron supports

commit_message:
Remove python 3.5 from L3 rootwrap filters

In L3 agent's rootwrap filters there are KillFilters
to allow killing of python processes (used to kill
neutron-keepalived-state-change-monitor script). There
was also filter for python3.5 but now Neutron supports
python3.6 and newer so python3.5 isn't needed there
anymore and this patch removes it from there.

Change-Id: I57fcc6b1c506dce9113b56ffee7d29a96fa7f251

commit_message:
Cleanup container driver inferface

* Remove get_container_name (this API is not used)
* Remove get_addresses (this API is not used)
* Remove get_host_info (this is a docker internal method)

Change-Id: I385f5f5526b2e61b7b11c05fadeab40c98a2c5cb

commit_message:
New validation: validate-selinux

This validation ensures we don't have any untracked AVCs in system
audit.log.
Such SELinux issues might lead to a broken deploy/user experience at
some point, so we probably better want to ensure we're on a clean
system.

This validation will also be used within the CI job in order to ensure a
green job doesn't have any AVC - for now, it's not checked at all...

Change-Id: I4b6b151a89f3fcf0a1ed94390175d2f8230b90d7
(cherry picked from commit 718a2ccd823e5f24639a425aedd439f005d6a554)

commit_message:
Remove the useless environment variable.

Remove the useless environment variable to set the virtualenv directory.
It's the default value and the variable was duplicate.

Change-Id: I599fe28a0b9f48cdbf02fd87c95506a3176244e2
(cherry picked from commit 32d410826da3dfc4c2250406e6542fa9fa49301c)

commit_message:
Fixes fluentd for rocky

Pin fluentd version to 1.8.x

fluentd has dropped support for ruby 2.3 and below at the end of 2019.

1) https://www.fluentd.org/blog/drop-schedule-announcement-in-2019
2) https://github.com/fluent/fluentd/pull/2750

Closes-Bug: #1860701

Change-Id: I29f54dc94a6e49118ce15401017947c07ed3ca54

commit_message:
[OVN] Bump ovsdbapp requirements to 1.0.0

Contains fixes for functional tests needed after the networking-ovn has
moved to Neutron and OVN splitting from the OVS repository upstream.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/704176/

Change-Id: If3d6a04bf47f7e308530a3e1abb20ebfc184451f
Related-Blueprint: neutron-ovn-merge

commit_message:
Drop use of unittest2

unittest2 was needed for Python version <= 2.6, so it hasn't been needed
for quite some time. See unittest2 note one:

https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html

This drops unittest2 in favor of the standard unittest module.

Change-Id: I2e787cfbf1709b7f9c889230a10c03689e032957
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove fixup_python_packages

The hack has be around for pip 1.4.1 and older. It should be safe to
remove it by now. In fact it causes problems in my Ubutu Bionic VM when
trying to overwrite httplib2 library installed from the distro package.

Change-Id: I34b826f4e8f10f8d44b888120f19fcc7ba501b3d

commit_message:
Refactor get_available_resources in container driver

Move docker-specific code to DockerDriver subclass.
After the refactoring, generic code stays in base class and
docker-specific code is moved to docker driver subclass.
As a result, we can re-use the generic code in base class
if we introduce a non-docker driver in the future.

Change-Id: I4a68b58f46bc7eaac494909647b87ada7813a8eb

commit_message:
Mask the token used to allow access to consoles

Hide the novncproxy token from the logs.

When backported this patch needs to be extended to handle the same issue
in the consoleauth service.

Co-Authored-By:paul-carlton2 <paul.carlton2@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By:Tristan Cacqueray <tdecacqu@redhat.com>

Conflicts:
  nova/console/websocketproxy.py due to
  I89df8f8fa111b730ddd0aa73ae09a8cd5d152dad missing from stable/stein

  nova/consoleauth/manager.py and
  nova/tests/unit/consoleauth/test_consoleauth.py due to consoleauth is
  removed from stable/train but affected by the bug in stable/stein

Change-Id: I5b8fa4233d297722c3af08176901d12887bae3de
Closes-Bug: #1492140
(cherry picked from commit 26d4047e17eba9bc271f8868f1d0ffeec97b555e)
(cherry picked from commit d7826bcd761af035f3f76f67c607dde2a1d04e48)

commit_message:
Strictly require service token roles

This patch enables service_token_roles_required in authtoken,
so that we strictly restrict the user who can issue a request
with service user token against OpenStack services.

Conflicts:
	deployment/manila/manila-api-container-puppet.yaml

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667251/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667252/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670429/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670430/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677113/
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703536/
Change-Id: Ie20cf74f216ea826ba76a55e55070c49a5e9be84

commit_message:
Remove get_ports_by_attrs by simply use args in query ports.

get_ports_by_attrs was using neutron client for obtaining ports with
specified attribites. OpenStackSDK have this OOTB, so that one can query
for ports simply by using os.network.ports(name=, tags=[뵣, ), so,
there is no need for additional function.

Also, make use of previously added real port object in tests. By using
openstack.network.v2.port.Port objects we gain such confidence
that we are dealing with an port object, dict, tuple, or any other data
type, so that we can treat it accordingly in the code.

Implements: blueprint switch-to-openstacksdk
Change-Id: I7b597f7229113a598de631641bde04e083fea4b5

commit_message:
Provide default implementation for several methods

* Implement get_total_disk_for_container
* Implement get_available_nodes
* Implement node_support_disk_quota

Later, we will introduce another container driver and these default
implementation can be re-used.

Change-Id: I67d895844aada6c1743741e6d051aa25109fd1b9

commit_message:
Update sriov driver to use OpenStackSDK.

Implements: blueprint switch-to-openstacksdk
Change-Id: I81edb28196dc95662030bbb0961bb227ae7d13dd

Seems like lower-constraints gate is still broken here. The logs [1] indicate that ports get created until we exhaust all the available addresses. Unfortunately there's no way to get the initial exception.

I'm tempted to just raise openstacksdk version in lower-constraints anyway, but still it would be good to understand the root cause as otherwise.

Are you doing something like:

 foo(**an_openstacksdk_object)

anywhere? Maybe it's that, I see Maysa's code causing the same with older openstacksdk:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-09 14:27:11.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor of os_vif_util module.

Besides refactor itself, there was several issues resolved, like
appropriate data handling - because macvlan driver is still using
neutron client, we have to deal with dict data and openstacksdk objects
at the same time in couple of helper methods in os_vif_util module.

Furthermore, helper method for creating port object for test purposes

commit_message:
Refactor of os_vif_util module.

Besides refactor itself, there was several issues resolved, like
appropriate data handling - because macvlan driver is still using
neutron client, we have to deal with dict data and openstacksdk objects
at the same time in couple of helper methods in os_vif_util module.

Furthermore, helper method for creating port object for test purposes
was moved to fake module, since it is also utilized in test for os vif
utils.

Change-Id: Iefc758ac22e1688ca9d017d5a4c1d32c4cf0583a
Implements: blueprint switch-to-openstacksdk

'}, {'created': '2020-01-16 23:31:25.000000000', 'message': 'barbican: fix values overrides for stein and ocata

policies were duplicated. This moves the ocata overrides back to where

commit_message:
barbican: fix values overrides for stein and ocata

When the default release was switched from ocata to stein, some of the
policies were duplicated. This moves the ocata overrides back to where
they belong, and adds overrides for pike, queens, and rocky.

Change-Id: I342d69e721b2692987951055e41ed5e153a91d6c

commit_message:
Fix typos for update_available_resource reference

Fixing a couple of typos that wrongly refers to
update_available_resources()
insted of update_available_resource()

[{'created': '2020-01-23 08:38:30.000000000', 'message': "Set octavia services' stop grace period to 300sec

Octavia worker, house-keeping and health-monitor serivices may use some
long taskflow's flows to handle load balancers and amphorae (launch VMs,
etc...). Those flows should not be interrupted when restarting those
services (i.e when updating an overcloud, or restarting services because
of certificates rotation), it might cause resource leaks that cannot be
fixed by an admin.

As default container stop timeout is defined to 10 seconds, this timeout
value needs to be increased for octavia services (except octavia api) to
ensure a graceful shutdown.
This new value has been set to 300 seconds according to the octavia
worker default configuration introduced in
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/684201/

Closes-Bug: #1855684
Change-Id: I8911a79328769c910d03168cfa5a421d0dd0f9b6
(cherry picked from commit c595835776eccbc2f59b69574f0aa5c3e87c9bd5)
"}]
commit_message:
Set octavia services' stop grace period to 300sec

Octavia worker, house-keeping and health-monitor serivices may use some
long taskflow's flows to handle load balancers and amphorae (launch VMs,
etc...). Those flows should not be interrupted when restarting those
services (i.e when updating an overcloud, or restarting services because
of certificates rotation), it might cause resource leaks that cannot be
fixed by an admin.

As default container stop timeout is defined to 10 seconds, this timeout
value needs to be increased for octavia services (except octavia api) to
ensure a graceful shutdown.
This new value has been set to 300 seconds according to the octavia
worker default configuration introduced in
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/684201/

Closes-Bug: #1855684
Change-Id: I8911a79328769c910d03168cfa5a421d0dd0f9b6
(cherry picked from commit c595835776eccbc2f59b69574f0aa5c3e87c9bd5)

need to be accessed via HTTPS. This patch updates the URL builder
to take this into consideration.

commit_message:
Image uploader: use HTTPS for "no verify" registries

Registries with an invalid SSL certificate are insecure, but still
need to be accessed via HTTPS. This patch updates the URL builder
to take this into consideration.

Closes-Bug: #1858672
Change-Id: I71436313098f513c200ecc3f862a2b851fb1060a
(cherry picked from commit dcf99e7167b7827b6edaf10b460a0dd5e57cdddb)
(cherry picked from commit f6bcc3bcdb88ec385c9b308a0f33a6187a7824ef)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-18 12:37:33.000000000', 'message': "Add region into octavia user credential in authtoken configuration

While we can customize region where octavia user is created,
we didn't set the specified region in octavia user credential
in user credential configuration for authtoken middleware.

This patch adds the missing region parameter, so that we can
make sure that we use the same region assigned to octavia user.

Change-Id: Icc0ee9a859c2c67cae92339c6b4102946150269f
"}, {'created': '2020-01-18 12:57:11.000000000', 'message': "Set region in authtoken middleware settings

While we can specify keystone region where all keystone resources
are created, currently we don't set the specified region correctly
in credential configurations used for authtoken middleware.

Configure region parameter for authtoken according to the parameter
KeystoneRegion so that we're consistent about the region where
we expect to have service users created.

Change-Id: Icc0ee9a859c2c67cae92339c6b4102946150269f
"}, {'created': '2020-01-18 13:00:00.000000000', 'message': "Set region in authtoken middleware settings

While we can specify keystone region where all keystone resources
are created, currently we don't set the specified region correctly
in credential configurations used for authtoken middleware.

Configure region parameter for authtoken according to the parameter
KeystoneRegion so that we're consistent about the region where
we expect to have service users created.

Change-Id: Icc0ee9a859c2c67cae92339c6b4102946150269f
"}]
commit_message:
Set region in authtoken middleware settings

While we can specify keystone region where all keystone resources
are created, currently we don't set the specified region correctly
in credential configurations used for authtoken middleware.

Configure region parameter for authtoken according to the parameter
KeystoneRegion so that we're consistent about the region where
we expect to have service users created.

Change-Id: Icc0ee9a859c2c67cae92339c6b4102946150269f

[{'created': '2020-01-23 16:59:53.000000000', 'message': 'Check to make sure compute service is deployed before scale down

Currently during a node scale down using openstack overcloud
node delete, we assume the that nova-compute is enabled on the
node and is working as expected. However, the node scale down
fails in cases where the node being scaled is not correctly
behaving as a compute node (nova containers not running/reporting
to the overcloud). This patch includes a check to only disable
and stop nova services if they are running. We ran into this
scenario when we wanted to scale down a node that did not cleanly
deploy as a compute node due to failure in step 5 in a large scale
environment.

Change-Id: Ic8225af65c409b6a32d4bb2def370c7c802147fa
Co-Authored-By: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1860694

commit_message:
Check to make sure compute service is deployed before scale down

Currently during a node scale down using openstack overcloud
node delete, we assume the that nova-compute is enabled on the
node and is working as expected. However, the node scale down
fails in cases where the node being scaled is not correctly
behaving as a compute node (nova containers not running/reporting
to the overcloud). This patch includes a check to only disable
and stop nova services if they are running. We ran into this
scenario when we wanted to scale down a node that did not cleanly
deploy as a compute node due to failure in step 5 in a large scale
environment.

Change-Id: Ic8225af65c409b6a32d4bb2def370c7c802147fa
Co-Authored-By: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1860694
Signed-off-by: Sai Sindhur Malleni <smalleni@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-01-23 00:35:14.000000000', 'message': "Remove TEMPEST_BRANCH var from neutron queens job.

In devstack install_Tempest, ref is taken by TEMPEST_BRANCH var[1]. TEMPEST_BRANCH var on zuul job
definitoin is priority than the default value in devstack[2]. When we set the queens compatible Tempest
tag[1] (with review style not by tag name) on devstack stable/queens, that is not taken by devstack
because neutron queens job define the smae with different value[4].

Also Tag name (for example queens-em) never work because of devstack logic. Tempest tag name only work
if RECLONE is true otherwise it should be gerrit ref style. So always Tempest master is installed
on queens jobs.

Let's remove the TEMPEST_BRANCH from neutron jobs and rely on devstack deafult value.

CLoses-Bug: 1859988
[1] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/stable/queens/lib/tempest#L658
[2] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/786c485cf6d664163b4ee3d390c62693a9e0d036/stackrc#L313
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703679/
[4] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/0cc32b278afe4e51b787d87d480f7092/log/job-output.txt#12370

Change-Id: I07beb6e7bdcbaf7ffe72d47f9edb90df40641e68

commit_message:
Remove TEMPEST_BRANCH var from neutron queens job.

In devstack install_Tempest, ref is taken by TEMPEST_BRANCH var[1]. TEMPEST_BRANCH var on zuul job
definitoin is priority than the default value in devstack[2]. When we set the queens compatible Tempest
tag[1] (with review style not by tag name) on devstack stable/queens, that is not taken by devstack
because neutron queens job define the smae with different value[4].

Also Tag name (for example queens-em) never work because of devstack logic. Tempest tag name only work
if RECLONE is true otherwise it should be gerrit ref style. So always Tempest master is installed
on queens jobs.

Let's remove the TEMPEST_BRANCH from neutron jobs and rely on devstack deafult value.

CLoses-Bug: 1859988
[1] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/stable/queens/lib/tempest#L658
[2] https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/786c485cf6d664163b4ee3d390c62693a9e0d036/stackrc#L313
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703679/
[4] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/0cc32b278afe4e51b787d87d480f7092/log/job-output.txt#12370

Change-Id: I07beb6e7bdcbaf7ffe72d47f9edb90df40641e68

commit_message:
Make pcsd listen on PacemakerNetwork/PacemakerRemoteNetwork

Configure bind address for pcsd so that it listens on a specific
network instead of all available networks.

Closes-Bug: #1856626
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/700287
Change-Id: Icc78fb96b28cd7a036d958ba78b2075e7c241207
(cherry picked from commit 3056f25bd1763a773a1acbab0f465d0f5bf5b778)

commit_message:
Update network_policy driver to use OpenStackSDK.

Besides driver itself, there was a change also for utils/os_vif_util
modules, since while changing neutron objects to OpenStackSDK objects,
signature has also changed.

Also, favor of using attribute based access for Munch objects (all
OpenStackSDK objects are basically Munch based), so that we can also
have these working in older version of OpenStackSDK.

Implements: blueprint switch-to-openstacksdk
Change-Id: I7db217aa9f2b09b38d5e8709cf3712646f6b6893

subject: [ovn] Agent liveness - allow time to propagate checks
